pli-tv-bi-pm:1.1.pli: Sammajjanī padīpo ca, udakaṃ āsanena ca;
pli-tv-bi-pm:1.1.eng: Sweeping, lamps, setting up of water and seats;

pli-tv-bi-pm:1.2.eng: these are to be done before the observance-day ceremony.

pli-tv-bi-pm:2.1.pli: Chanda, pārisuddhi, utukkhānaṃ, bhikkhunigaṇanā ca ovādo;
pli-tv-bi-pm:2.1.eng: Consent, purity, knowing the season, counting the nuns and instruction;

pli-tv-bi-pm:2.2.eng: these are the preliminary duties of the observance-day ceremony.

pli-tv-bi-pm:3.1.eng: It is the observance day, all the nuns who should be present have arrived,

pli-tv-bi-pm:3.3.pli: Vajjanīyā ca puggalā tasmiṃ na honti, “pattakalla”nti vuccati.
pli-tv-bi-pm:3.3.eng: and there is no-one there who should not be present. This is called readiness.

pli-tv-bi-pm:4.1.pli: Pubbakaraṇapubbakiccāni samāpetvā desitāpattikassa samaggassa bhikkhunisaṅghassa anumatiyā pātimokkhaṃ uddisituṃ ārādhanaṃ karoma.
pli-tv-bi-pm:4.1.eng: Having completed the duties to be done beforehand and the preliminary duties, with the assent of the nuns’ community, one and all, with offenses confessed, I invite the recitation of the Monastic Code.
pli-tv-bi-pm:4.1.comm: There is no ti in the Pali at the end of the paragraph, but quotation marks seem required because there is a shift of speaker.

pli-tv-bi-pm:5.1.eng: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bi-pm:5.1.comm: This is where the recitation of the Pātimokkha begins, thus the open quote. The end quote is found at the end of the recitation. There are headings in between that should not be included within the quotes. To simplify the editing process, I have not separated these out.

pli-tv-bi-pm:5.2.eng: Today is the observance day, the fifteenth.

pli-tv-bi-pm:5.3.pli: yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho uposathaṃ kareyya, pātimokkhaṃ uddiseyya.
pli-tv-bi-pm:5.3.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should do the observance-day ceremony, it should recite the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-bi-pm:6.1.eng: What is the preliminary duty of the Sangha?

pli-tv-bi-pm:6.2.eng: The venerables should declare their purity.

pli-tv-bi-pm:6.3.eng: I will recite the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-bi-pm:6.4.pli: taṃ sabbāva santā sādhukaṃ suṇoma manasi karoma.
pli-tv-bi-pm:6.4.eng: Everyone present should listen to it and attend carefully.

pli-tv-bi-pm:6.5.eng: Anyone who has committed an offense should reveal it.

pli-tv-bi-pm:6.6.eng: If you haven’t committed any offense, you should remain silent.

pli-tv-bi-pm:6.7.eng: If you are silent, I will regard you as pure.

pli-tv-bi-pm:6.8.pli: Yathā kho pana paccekapuṭṭhassā veyyākaraṇaṃ hoti, evamevaṃ evarūpāya parisāya yāvatatiyaṃ anusāvitaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:6.8.eng: Just as one responds when asked individually, so too, an announcement is made three times in this kind of gathering.

pli-tv-bi-pm:6.9.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī yāvatatiyaṃ anusāviyamāne saramānā santiṃ āpattiṃ nāvikareyya, sampajānamusāvādassā hoti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:6.9.eng: If a nun remembers an offense while the announcement is being made up to the third time, but doesn’t reveal it, she is lying in full awareness.

pli-tv-bi-pm:6.10.pli: Sampajānamusāvādo kho panāyyāyo, antarāyiko dhammo vutto bhagavatā,
pli-tv-bi-pm:6.10.eng: Lying in full awareness is called an obstacle by the Buddha.

pli-tv-bi-pm:6.11.pli: tasmā saramānāya bhikkhuniyā āpannāya visuddhāpekkhāya santī āpatti āvikātabbā,
pli-tv-bi-pm:6.11.eng: A nun who remembers an offense and is seeking purification should therefore reveal it.

pli-tv-bi-pm:6.12.eng: When it’s revealed, she will be at ease.

pli-tv-bi-pm:7.1.eng: Venerables, the introduction has been recited.

pli-tv-bi-pm:7.2.eng: In regard to this I ask you, ‘Are you pure in this?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:7.3.eng: A second time I ask, ‘Are you pure in this?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:7.4.eng: A third time I ask, ‘Are you pure in this?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:7.5.eng: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’
pli-tv-bi-pm:7.5.comm: I have ignored the ti after dhārayāmi here and below. It is not found in all versions of the Pātimokkha, and it does not fit the context.

pli-tv-bi-pm:8.0.eng: The recitation of the rules on expulsion

pli-tv-bi-pm:8.1.pli: Tatrime aṭṭha pārājikā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:8.1.eng: Venerables, these eight rules on expulsion come up for recitation.

pli-tv-bi-pm:9.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī chandaso methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭiseveyya, antamaso tiracchānagatenapi, pārājikā hoti asaṃvāsā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:9.1.eng: If a nun willingly has sexual intercourse, even with a male animal, she is expelled and excluded from the community.
pli-tv-bi-pm:9.1.comm: For a detailed discussion of this rule, see Appendix on Individual Bhikkhunī Rules.

pli-tv-bi-pm:10.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī gāmā vā araññā vā adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyeyya,
pli-tv-bi-pm:10.1.eng: If a nun, intending to steal, takes from an inhabited area or from the wilderness what has not been given to her—

pli-tv-bi-pm:10.2.pli: yathārūpe adinnādāne rājāno coraṃ gahetvā haneyyuṃ vā bandheyyuṃ vā pabbājeyyuṃ vā corāsi bālāsi mūḷhāsi thenāsīti, tathārūpaṃ bhikkhunī adinnaṃ ādiyamānā
pli-tv-bi-pm:10.2.eng: the sort of stealing for which kings, having caught a thief, would beat, imprison, or banish her, saying, ‘You’re a bandit, you’re a fool, you’ve gone astray, you’re a thief’—

pli-tv-bi-pm:10.3.eng: she is expelled and excluded from the community.

pli-tv-bi-pm:11.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī sañcicca manussaviggahaṃ jīvitā voropeyya, satthahārakaṃ vāssa pariyeseyya, maraṇavaṇṇaṃ vā saṃvaṇṇeyya, maraṇāya vā samādapeyya,
pli-tv-bi-pm:11.1.eng: If a nun intentionally kills a human being or seeks an instrument of death for them or praises death or incites someone to die, saying,

pli-tv-bi-pm:11.2.pli: “ambho purisa, kiṃ tuyhiminā pāpakena dujjīvitena, mataṃ te jīvitā seyyo”ti,
pli-tv-bi-pm:11.2.eng: ‘My friend, what’s the point of this miserable and difficult life? Death is better for you than life!’—

pli-tv-bi-pm:11.3.pli: iti cittamanā cittasaṅkappā anekapariyāyena maraṇavaṇṇaṃ vā saṃvaṇṇeyya, maraṇāya vā samādapeyya,
pli-tv-bi-pm:11.3.eng: thinking and intending thus, if she praises death in many ways or incites someone to die—

pli-tv-bi-pm:11.4.eng: she too is expelled and excluded from the community.

pli-tv-bi-pm:12.0.eng: Expulsion 4: laying false claim to superhuman attainments

pli-tv-bi-pm:12.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī anabhijānaṃ uttarimanussadhammaṃ attupanāyikaṃ alamariyañāṇadassanaṃ samudācareyya, “iti jānāmi, iti passāmī”ti,
pli-tv-bi-pm:12.1.eng: If a nun falsely claims for herself a superhuman quality, a knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones, saying, ‘This I know, this I see,’

pli-tv-bi-pm:12.2.pli: tato aparena samayena samanuggāhīyamānā vā asamanuggāhīyamānā vā āpannā visuddhāpekkhā evaṃ vadeyya, “ajānamevaṃ, ayye, avacaṃ jānāmi, apassaṃ passāmi, tucchaṃ musā vilapi”nti,
pli-tv-bi-pm:12.2.eng: but after some time—whether she is questioned or not, but having committed the offense and seeking purification—should say: ‘Not knowing I said that I know, not seeing that I see; what I said was empty and false,’ then,

pli-tv-bi-pm:12.3.eng: except if it is due to overestimation,

pli-tv-bi-pm:12.4.eng: she too is expelled and excluded from the community.

pli-tv-bi-pm:13.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī avassutā avassutassa purisapuggalassa, adhakkhakaṃ ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalaṃ āmasanaṃ vā parāmasanaṃ vā gahaṇaṃ vā chupanaṃ vā paṭipīḷanaṃ vā sādiyeyya, ayampi pārājikā hoti asaṃvāsā ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalikā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:13.1.eng: If a lustful nun consents to a lustful man making physical contact with her, to touching her, to taking hold of her, to contacting her, or to squeezing her, anywhere below the collar bone but above the knees, she too is expelled and excluded from the community. The training rule on above the knees.

pli-tv-bi-pm:14.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī jānaṃ pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpannaṃ bhikkhuniṃ nevattanā paṭicodeyya, na gaṇassa āroceyya, yadā ca sā ṭhitā vā assa cutā vā nāsitā vā avassaṭā vā, sā pacchā evaṃ vadeyya: “pubbevāhaṃ, ayye, aññāsiṃ etaṃ bhikkhuniṃ ‘evarūpā ca evarūpā ca sā bhaginī’ti, no ca kho attanā paṭicodessaṃ, na gaṇassa ārocessa”nti, ayampi pārājikā hoti asaṃvāsā vajjappaṭicchādikā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:14.1.eng: If a nun knows that a nun has committed an offense entailing expulsion, but she neither confronts her herself nor tells a group of nuns, and afterward—whether that nun remains or has died or has been expelled or has converted—she says, ‘Venerables, although I previously knew that this nun was like this, I thought, I will neither confront her myself nor tell a group of nuns, she too is expelled and excluded from the community. The training rule on those who conceal offenses.

pli-tv-bi-pm:15.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī samaggena saṅghena ukkhittaṃ bhikkhuṃ dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena anādaraṃ appaṭikāraṃ akatasahāyaṃ tamanuvatteyya, sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi evamassa vacanīyā:
pli-tv-bi-pm:15.1.eng: If a nun takes sides with a monk who has been ejected by a unanimous Sangha—in accordance with the rule, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction—and who is disrespectful, who has not made amends, and who has not made friends, the nuns should correct her like this:

pli-tv-bi-pm:15.2.pli: “eso kho, ayye, bhikkhu samaggena saṅghena ukkhitto, dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena anādaro appaṭikāro akatasahāyo, māyye, etaṃ bhikkhuṃ anuvattī”ti,
pli-tv-bi-pm:15.2.eng: ‘Venerable, this monk has been ejected by a unanimous Sangha in accordance with the rule, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction. He’s disrespectful, hasn’t made amends, and hasn’t made friends. Venerable, don’t take sides with this monk.’

pli-tv-bi-pm:15.3.pli: evañca sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi vuccamānā tatheva paggaṇheyya, sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsitabbā tassa paṭinissaggāya,
pli-tv-bi-pm:15.3.eng: If that nun continues as before, the nuns should press her up to three times to make her stop.

pli-tv-bi-pm:15.4.pli: yāvatatiyaṃ ce samanubhāsiyamānā taṃ paṭinissajjeyya, iccetaṃ kusalaṃ,
pli-tv-bi-pm:15.4.eng: If she then stops, all is well.

pli-tv-bi-pm:15.5.pli: no ce paṭinissajjeyya, ayampi pārājikā hoti asaṃvāsā ukkhittānuvattikā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:15.5.eng: If she does not stop, she too is expelled and excluded from the community. The training rule on taking sides with one who has been ejected.

pli-tv-bi-pm:16.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī avassutā avassutassa purisapuggalassa hatthaggahaṇaṃ vā sādiyeyya, saṅghāṭikaṇṇaggahaṇaṃ vā sādiyeyya, santiṭṭheyya vā, sallapeyya vā, saṅketaṃ vā gaccheyya, purisassa vā abbhāgamanaṃ sādiyeyya, channaṃ vā anupaviseyya, kāyaṃ vā tadatthāya upasaṃhareyya etassa asaddhammassa paṭisevanatthāya, ayampi pārājikā hoti asaṃvāsā aṭṭhavatthukā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:16.1.eng: If, for the purpose of indulging in inappropriate sexual conduct, a lustful nun consents to a lustful man holding her hand and the edge of her robe, and she stands with him and chats with him and goes to an appointment with him and consents to him coming to her and enters a covered place with him and disposes her body for him for that purpose, she too is expelled and excluded from the community. The training rule having eight parts.

pli-tv-bi-pm:17.1.pli: Uddiṭṭhā kho, ayyāyo, aṭṭha pārājikā dhammā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:17.1.eng: Venerables, the eight rules on expulsion have been recited.

pli-tv-bi-pm:17.2.pli: Yesaṃ bhikkhunī aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā āpajjitvā na labhati bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ saṃvāsaṃ
pli-tv-bi-pm:17.2.eng: If a nun commits any one of them, she is no longer part of the community of nuns.

pli-tv-bi-pm:17.3.pli: yathā pure, tathā pacchā, pārājikā hoti asaṃvāsā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:17.3.eng: As before, so after: she’s expelled and excluded from the community.

pli-tv-bi-pm:17.4.eng: In regard to this I ask you, ‘Are you pure in this?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:17.5.eng: A second time I ask, ‘Are you pure in this?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:17.6.eng: A third time I ask, ‘Are you pure in this?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:17.7.eng: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’

pli-tv-bi-pm:17.8.eng: The offenses entailing expulsion are finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:18.0.eng: Recitation of the rules on suspension

pli-tv-bi-pm:18.1.pli: Ime kho panāyyāyo sattarasa saṅghādisesā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:18.1.eng: Venerables, these seventeen rules on suspension come up for recitation.

pli-tv-bi-pm:19.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī ussayavādikā vihareyya gahapatinā vā gahapatiputtena vā dāsena vā kammakārena vā antamaso samaṇaparibbājakenāpi, ayampi bhikkhunī paṭhamāpattikaṃ dhammaṃ āpannā nissāraṇīyaṃ saṅghādisesaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:19.1.eng: If a nun takes legal action against a householder or a householder’s offspring or a slave or a worker or even toward a monastic or a wanderer, then that nun has committed an immediate offense entailing sending away and suspension.

pli-tv-bi-pm:20.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī jānaṃ coriṃ vajjhaṃ viditaṃ anapaloketvā rājānaṃ vā saṅghaṃ vā gaṇaṃ vā pūgaṃ vā seṇiṃ vā, aññatra kappā vuṭṭhāpeyya, ayampi bhikkhunī paṭhamāpattikaṃ dhammaṃ āpannā nissāraṇīyaṃ saṅghādisesaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:20.1.eng: If a nun, without getting permission from the king or the Sangha or a community or an association or a society, gives the full admission to a woman who she knows is a criminal and who is known as sentenced to death, then, except when it is allowable, that nun too has committed an immediate offense entailing sending away and suspension.

pli-tv-bi-pm:21.0.eng: Suspension 3: walking alone to the next inhabited area

pli-tv-bi-pm:21.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī ekā vā gāmantaraṃ gaccheyya, ekā vā nadīpāraṃ gaccheyya, ekā vā rattiṃ vippavaseyya, ekā vā gaṇamhā ohiyeyya, ayampi bhikkhunī paṭhamāpattikaṃ dhammaṃ āpannā nissāraṇīyaṃ saṅghādisesaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:21.1.eng: If a nun walks to the next inhabited area by herself or crosses a river by herself or spends the night apart by herself or lags behind her companions by herself, then that nun too has committed an immediate offense entailing sending away and suspension.

pli-tv-bi-pm:22.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī samaggena saṅghena ukkhittaṃ bhikkhuniṃ dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena anapaloketvā kārakasaṅghaṃ, anaññāya gaṇassa chandaṃ osāreyya, ayampi bhikkhunī paṭhamāpattikaṃ dhammaṃ āpannā nissāraṇīyaṃ saṅghādisesaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:22.1.eng: If a nun, without getting permission from the Sangha that did the legal procedure and without the consent of the community, readmits a nun who has been ejected by a unanimous Sangha in accordance with the rule and the Monastic Law and the Teacher’s instruction, then that nun too has committed an immediate offense entailing sending away and suspension.

pli-tv-bi-pm:23.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī avassutā avassutassa purisapuggalassa hatthato khādanīyaṃ vā, bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, ayampi bhikkhunī paṭhamāpattikaṃ dhammaṃ āpannā nissāraṇīyaṃ saṅghādisesaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:23.1.eng: If a lustful nun eats fresh or cooked food after receiving it directly from a lustful man, then that nun too has committed an immediate offense entailing sending away and suspension.

pli-tv-bi-pm:24.0.eng: Suspension 6: encouraging receiving food from one with lust

pli-tv-bi-pm:24.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī evaṃ vadeyya: “kiṃ te, ayye, eso purisapuggalo karissati avassuto vā anavassuto vā, yato tvaṃ anavassutā, iṅgha, ayye, yaṃ te eso purisapuggalo deti khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā, taṃ tvaṃ sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khāda vā bhuñja vā”ti, ayampi bhikkhunī paṭhamāpattikaṃ dhammaṃ āpannā nissāraṇīyaṃ saṅghādisesaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:24.1.eng: If a nun says, ‘Venerable, what can this man do to you, whether he has lust or not, if you’re without? Go on, Venerable, receive it with your own hands and then eat whatever fresh or cooked food he gives you,’ then that nun too has committed an immediate offense entailing sending away and suspension.

pli-tv-bi-pm:25.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī sañcarittaṃ samāpajjeyya itthiyā vā purisamatiṃ, purisassa vā itthimatiṃ, jāyattane vā jārattane vā antamaso taṅkhaṇikāyapi, ayampi bhikkhunī paṭhamāpattikaṃ dhammaṃ āpannā nissāraṇīyaṃ saṅghādisesaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:25.1.eng: If a nun acts as a matchmaker, conveying a man’s intention to a woman or a woman’s intention to a man, for marriage or for an affair, even if just a brief one, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-pm:26.0.eng: Suspension 8: making a groundless accusation out of anger

pli-tv-bi-pm:26.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniṃ duṭṭhā dosā appatītā amūlakena pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃseyya: “appeva nāma naṃ imamhā brahmacariyā cāveyya”nti,
pli-tv-bi-pm:26.1.eng: If a nun who is angry and displeased groundlessly charges a nun with an offense entailing expulsion, aiming to make her leave the monastic life,

pli-tv-bi-pm:26.2.pli: tato aparena samayena samanuggāhīyamānā vā asa manuggāhīyamānā vā amūlakañceva taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ hoti, bhikkhunī ca dosaṃ patiṭṭhāti, ayampi bhikkhunī paṭhamāpattikaṃ dhammaṃ āpannā nissāraṇīyaṃ saṅghādisesaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:26.2.eng: and then after some time, whether she is questioned or not, it is clear that the legal issue is groundless, and she admits to her ill will, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-pm:27.0.eng: Suspension 9: making a Suspension 8: making a groundless accusation out of anger, using a pretext

pli-tv-bi-pm:27.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniṃ duṭṭhā dosā appatītā aññabhāgiyassa adhikaraṇassa kiñcidesaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāya pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃseyya, “appeva nāma naṃ imamhā brahmacariyā cāveyya”nti,
pli-tv-bi-pm:27.1.eng: If a nun who is angry and displeased, uses an unrelated legal issue as a pretext to charge a nun with an offense entailing expulsion, aiming to make her leave the monastic life,

pli-tv-bi-pm:27.2.pli: tato aparena samayena samanuggāhīyamānā vā asamanuggāhīyamānā vā aññabhāgiyañceva taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ hoti. Kocideso lesamatto upādinno, bhikkhunī ca dosaṃ patiṭṭhāti, ayampi bhikkhunī paṭhamāpattikaṃ dhammaṃ āpannā nissāraṇīyaṃ saṅghādisesaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:27.2.eng: and then after some time, whether she is questioned or not, it is clear that the legal issue is unrelated and was used as pretext, and she admits to her ill will, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-pm:28.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī kupitā anattamanā evaṃ vadeyya:
pli-tv-bi-pm:28.1.eng: If a nun says in anger,

pli-tv-bi-pm:28.2.pli: “buddhaṃ paccācikkhāmi dhammaṃ paccācikkhāmi, saṅghaṃ paccācikkhāmi, sikkhaṃ paccācikkhāmi, kinnumāva samaṇiyo yā samaṇiyo sakyadhītaro, santaññāpi samaṇiyo lajjiniyo kukkuccikā sikkhākāmā, tāsāhaṃ santike brahmacariyaṃ carissāmī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:28.2.eng: I renounce the Buddha, I renounce the Teaching, I renounce the Sangha, I renounce the training! The Sakyan daughters are not the only monastics. There are other monastics who have a sense of conscience, who are afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training. I’ll practice the spiritual life with them,’

pli-tv-bi-pm:28.3.eng: then the nuns should correct her like this:

pli-tv-bi-pm:31.3.eng: There are other nuns in the Sangha who have such behavior, reputation, and notoriety, and who harass the Sangha of nuns and hide each other’s offenses. The Sangha says nothing to them.

pli-tv-bi-pm:32.1.eng: If a nun pursues schism in a united Sangha or persists in taking up a legal issue conducive to schism, the nuns should correct her like this,

pli-tv-bi-pm:32.2.pli: “māyyā, samaggassa saṅghassa bhedāya parakkami, bhedanasaṃvattanikaṃ vā adhikaraṇaṃ samādāya paggayha aṭṭhāsi,

pli-tv-bi-pm:34.2.eng: ‘Venerables, don’t say anything to me, either good or bad, and I won’t say anything to you, either good or bad.

pli-tv-bi-pm:34.4.eng: then the nuns should correct her like this:

pli-tv-bi-pm:34.5.pli: “māyyā, attānaṃ avacanīyaṃ akāsi, vacanīyameva, ayyā, attānaṃ karotu,

pli-tv-bi-pm:35.0.eng: Suspension 17: being a corrupter of families

pli-tv-bi-pm:35.1.pli: Bhikkhunī paneva aññataraṃ gāmaṃ vā nigamaṃ vā upanissāya viharati kuladūsikā pāpasamācārā, tassā kho pāpakā samācārā dissanti ceva suyyanti ca, kulāni ca tāya duṭṭhāni dissanti ceva suyyanti ca,
pli-tv-bi-pm:35.1.eng: If a nun who lives supported by a village or town is a corrupter of families and badly behaved, and her bad behavior has been seen and heard about, and the families corrupted by her have been seen and heard about,

pli-tv-bi-pm:35.2.eng: then the nuns should correct her like this:

pli-tv-bi-pm:35.3.pli: “ayyā, kho kuladūsikā pāpasamācārā, ayyāya kho pāpakā samācārā dissanti ceva suyyanti ca, kulāni cāyyāya, duṭṭhāni dissanti ceva suyyanti ca, pakkamatāyyā imamhā āvāsā, alaṃ te idha vāsenā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:35.3.eng: ‘Venerable, you’re a corrupter of families and badly behaved. Your bad behavior has been seen and heard about, and the families corrupted by you have been seen and heard about. Leave this monastery; you’ve stayed here long enough.’

pli-tv-bi-pm:35.4.pli: Evañca sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi vuccamānā tā bhikkhuniyo evaṃ vadeyya:

pli-tv-bi-pm:35.5.pli: “chandagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo, dosagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo, mohagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo, bhayagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo, tādisikāya āpattiyā ekaccaṃ pabbājenti ekaccaṃ na pabbājentī”ti,
pli-tv-bi-pm:35.5.eng: ‘You’re acting out of desire, ill will, confusion, and fear. Because of this sort of offense, you only banish some, but not others,’

pli-tv-bi-pm:35.6.eng: then the nuns should correct her like this:

pli-tv-bi-pm:35.7.pli: “māyyā, evaṃ avaca, na ca bhikkhuniyo chandagāminiyo, na ca bhikkhuniyo dosagāminiyo , na ca bhikkhuniyo mohagāminiyo, na ca bhikkhuniyo bhayagāminiyo,
pli-tv-bi-pm:35.7.eng: ‘No, venerable, the nuns are not acting out of desire, ill will, confusion, and fear.

pli-tv-bi-pm:36.1.pli: Uddiṭṭhā kho ayyāyo sattarasa saṅghādisesā dhammā nava paṭhamāpattikā, aṭṭha yāvatatiyakā,
pli-tv-bi-pm:36.1.eng: “Venerables, the seventeen rules on suspension have been recited, nine being immediate offenses, eight after the third announcement.

pli-tv-bi-pm:36.2.pli: yesaṃ bhikkhunī aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā āpajjati, tāya bhikkhuniyā ubhatosaṅghe pakkhamānattaṃ caritabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:36.2.eng: If a nun commits any one of them, she is to must undertake a trial period for a half-month toward both Sanghas.

pli-tv-bi-pm:36.3.pli: Ciṇṇamānattā bhikkhunī yattha siyā vīsatigaṇo bhikkhunisaṅgho, tattha sā bhikkhunī abbhetabbā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:36.3.eng: When this is completed, she is to be rehabilitated wherever there is a sangha of at least twenty nuns.

pli-tv-bi-pm:36.4.pli: Ekāyapi ce ūno vīsatigaṇo bhikkhunisaṅgho taṃ bhikkhuniṃ abbheyya, sā ca bhikkhunī anabbhitā, tā ca bhikkhuniyo gārayhā, ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.
pli-tv-bi-pm:36.4.eng: If that nun is rehabilitated by a sangha of nuns of even one less than twenty, that nun is not rehabilitated and those nuns are at fault. This is the proper procedure.

pli-tv-bi-pm:36.5.eng: In regard to this I ask you, ‘Are you pure in this?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:36.6.eng: A second time I ask, ‘Are you pure in this?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:36.7.eng: A third time I ask, ‘Are you pure in this?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:36.8.eng: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’

pli-tv-bi-pm:36.9.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:37.0.eng: The rules on relinquishment and confession

pli-tv-bi-pm:37.1.pli: Ime kho panāyyāyo tiṃsa nissaggiyā pācittiyā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:37.1.eng: Venerables, these thirty rules on relinquishment and confession come up for recitation.

pli-tv-bi-pm:38.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī pattasannicayaṃ kareyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:38.1.eng: If a nun collects almsbowls, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:39.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 2: distributing out-of-season robe-cloth

pli-tv-bi-pm:39.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī akālacīvaraṃ “kālacīvara”nti adhiṭṭhahitvā bhājāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:39.1.eng: If a nun determines out-of-season robe-cloth as ‘in-season’, and then distributes it, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:40.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 3: taking back a swapped robe

pli-tv-bi-pm:40.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ cīvaraṃ parivattetvā sā pacchā evaṃ vadeyya: “handāyye, tuyhaṃ cīvaraṃ, āhara metaṃ cīvaraṃ, yaṃ tuyhaṃ tuyhamevetaṃ, yaṃ mayhaṃ mayhamevetaṃ, āhara metaṃ cīvaraṃ, sakaṃ paccāharā”ti acchindeyya vā acchindāpeyya vā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:40.1.eng: If a nun swaps robes with a nun and then says, ‘Here’s your robe; give me that robe of mine. That which is yours is yours, and that which is mine is mine. Give me that, and take back what’s yours;’ and she just takes it or has it taken, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:41.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 4: asking for something else

pli-tv-bi-pm:41.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī aññaṃ viññāpetvā aññaṃ viññāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:41.1.eng: If a nun asks for one thing and then for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:42.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 5: exchanging for something else

pli-tv-bi-pm:42.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī aññaṃ cetāpetvā aññaṃ cetāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:42.1.eng: If a nun gets one thing in exchange and then something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:43.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 6: exchanging Sangha property

pli-tv-bi-pm:43.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena saṅghikena aññaṃ cetāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:43.1.eng: When a requisite belonging to the Sangha is designated for a specific purpose, if a nun exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:44.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 7: exchanging Sangha property that was asked for

pli-tv-bi-pm:44.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena saṅghikena saññācikena aññaṃ cetāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:44.1.eng: When a requisite belonging to the Sangha is designated for a specific purpose and was asked for, if a nun exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:45.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 8: exchanging collective property

pli-tv-bi-pm:45.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena mahājanikena aññaṃ cetāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:45.1.eng: When a collective requisite is designated for a specific purpose, if a nun exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:46.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 9: exchanging collective property that was asked for

pli-tv-bi-pm:46.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena mahājanikena saññācikena aññaṃ cetāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:46.1.eng: When a collective requisite is designated for a specific purpose and was asked for, if a nun exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:47.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 10: exchanging personal property

pli-tv-bi-pm:47.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena puggalikena saññācikena aññaṃ cetāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:47.1.eng: When a personal requisite is designated for a specific purpose and was asked for, if a nun exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:47.2.eng: The subchapter on bowls is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:48.0.2.eng: Relinquishment and confession 11: getting an expensive heavy cloak in exchange

pli-tv-bi-pm:48.1.pli: Garupāvuraṇaṃ pana bhikkhuniyā cetāpentiyā catukkaṃsaparamaṃ cetāpetabbaṃ. Tato ce uttari cetāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:48.1.eng: If a nun carries out an exchange to get a heavy cloak, it is to be worth at most four kaṁsa coins. If she gets one in exchange that is worth more than that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:49.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 12: getting an expensive light cloak in exchange

pli-tv-bi-pm:49.1.pli: Lahupāvuraṇaṃ pana bhikkhuniyā cetāpentiyā aḍḍhateyyakaṃsaparamaṃ cetāpetabbaṃ. Tato ce uttari cetāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:49.1.eng: If a nun carries out an exchange to get a light cloak, it is to be worth at most two-and-a-half kaṁsa coins. If she gets one in exchange that is worth more than that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:50.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 13: storing robe-cloth beyond ten days

pli-tv-bi-pm:50.1.pli: Niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhuniyā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine dasāhaparamaṃ atirekacīvaraṃ dhāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:50.1.eng: When her robe is finished and the robe season has ended, a nun should keep an extra robe for ten days at the most.

pli-tv-bi-pm:50.2.eng: If she keeps it longer than that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:51.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 14: staying apart from robes

pli-tv-bi-pm:51.1.pli: Niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhuniyā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine ekarattampi ce bhikkhunī ticīvarena vippavaseyya, aññatra bhikkhunisammutiyā nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:51.1.eng: When her robe is finished and the robe season has ended, if a nun stays apart from her three robes even for a single day, except if the nuns have agreed, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:52.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 15: storing robe-cloth beyond a month

pli-tv-bi-pm:52.1.pli: Niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhuniyā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine bhikkhuniyā paneva akālacīvaraṃ uppajjeyya, ākaṅkhamānāya bhikkhuniyā paṭiggahetabbaṃ,
pli-tv-bi-pm:52.1.eng: When her robe is finished and the robe season has ended, if out-of-season robe-cloth is given to a nun, she may receive it if she wishes.

pli-tv-bi-pm:52.2.eng: If she receives it, she should quickly make a robe.

pli-tv-bi-pm:52.3.pli: no cassa pāripūri, māsaparamaṃ tāya bhikkhuniyā taṃ cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ ūnassa pāripūriyā satiyā paccāsāya.
pli-tv-bi-pm:52.3.eng: If there is not enough cloth, but she is expecting more, she should keep it at most one month to make up the lack.

pli-tv-bi-pm:52.4.pli: Tato ce uttari nikkhipeyya satiyāpi paccāsāya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:52.4.eng: If she keeps it longer than that, then even if she expects more cloth, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:53.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 16: asking an unrelated person for a robe

pli-tv-bi-pm:53.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī aññātakaṃ gahapatiṃ vā gahapatāniṃ vā cīvaraṃ viññāpeyya aññatra samayā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:53.1.eng: If a nun asks an unrelated male or female householder for a robe, except on an appropriate occasion, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:53.2.pli: Tatthāyaṃ samayo acchinnacīvarā vā hoti bhikkhunī, naṭṭhacīvarā vā, ayaṃ tattha samayo.
pli-tv-bi-pm:53.2.eng: These are the appropriate occasions: her robes are stolen or her robes are lost.

pli-tv-bi-pm:54.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 17: accepting too many robes

pli-tv-bi-pm:54.1.pli: Tañce aññātako gahapati vā gahapatānī vā bahūhi cīvarehi abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavāreyya, santaruttaraparamaṃ tāya bhikkhuniyā tato cīvaraṃ sāditabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:54.1.eng: If an unrelated male or female householder invites that nun to take many robes, she should accept at most one sarong and one upper robe.

pli-tv-bi-pm:54.2.pli: Tato ce uttari sādiyeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:54.2.eng: If she accepts more than that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:55.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 18: requesting fine robes from a fund

pli-tv-bi-pm:55.1.pli: Bhikkhuniṃ paneva uddissa aññātakassa gahapatissa vā gahapatāniyā vā cīvaracetāpannaṃ upakkhaṭaṃ hoti:
pli-tv-bi-pm:55.1.eng: If a male or female householder has set aside a robe fund for an unrelated nun, thinking,

pli-tv-bi-pm:55.2.pli: “iminā cīvaracetāpannena cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuniṃ cīvarena acchādessāmī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:55.2.eng: ‘With this robe fund I will buy robe-cloth and give it to nun so-and-so;’

pli-tv-bi-pm:55.3.pli: Tatra cesā bhikkhunī pubbe appavāritā upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjeyya:
pli-tv-bi-pm:55.3.eng: and if that nun, without first being invited, goes to them and specifies the kind of robe-cloth she wants, saying,

pli-tv-bi-pm:55.4.pli: “sādhu vata, maṃ āyasmā iminā cīvaracetāpannena evarūpaṃ vā evarūpaṃ vā cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā acchādehī”ti
pli-tv-bi-pm:55.4.eng: ‘It would be good if you would use this robe fund to buy such-and-such robe-cloth and then give it to me,’

pli-tv-bi-pm:55.5.eng: and she does so because she wants something fine, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:56.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 19: requesting fine robes from a combined fund

pli-tv-bi-pm:56.1.pli: Bhikkhuniṃ paneva uddissa ubhinnaṃ aññātakānaṃ gahapatīnaṃ vā gahapatānīnaṃ vā paccekacīvaracetāpannāni upakkhaṭāni honti:
pli-tv-bi-pm:56.1.eng: If two male or female householders have set aside separate robe funds for an unrelated nun, thinking,

pli-tv-bi-pm:56.2.pli: “imehi mayaṃ paccekacīvaracetāpannehi paccekacīvarāni cetāpetvā itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuniṃ cīvarehi acchādessāmā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:56.2.eng: ‘With these separate robe funds we’ll buy separate robe-cloths and give them to nun so-and-so;’

pli-tv-bi-pm:56.3.pli: Tatra cesā bhikkhūnī pubbe appavāritā upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjeyya:
pli-tv-bi-pm:56.3.eng: and if that nun, without first being invited, goes to them and specifies the kind of robe-cloth she wants, saying,

pli-tv-bi-pm:56.4.pli: “sādhu vata maṃ āyasmanto imehi paccekacīvaracetāpannehi evarūpaṃ vā evarūpaṃ vā cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā acchādetha ubhova santā ekenā”ti
pli-tv-bi-pm:56.4.eng: ‘It would be good if you would put these separate robe funds together to buy such-and-such robe-cloth and then give it to me,’

pli-tv-bi-pm:56.5.eng: and she does so because she wants something fine, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:57.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 20: excessive prompting to get robe

pli-tv-bi-pm:57.1.pli: Bhikkhuniṃ paneva uddissa rājā vā rājabhoggo vā brāhmaṇo vā gahapatiko vā dūtena cīvaracetāpannaṃ pahiṇeyya:
pli-tv-bi-pm:57.1.eng: If a king, a king’s employee, a brahmin, or a householder sends a robe fund for a nun by messenger, saying,

pli-tv-bi-pm:57.2.pli: “iminā cīvaracetāpannena cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuniṃ cīvarena acchādehī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:57.2.eng: ‘Buy robe-cloth with this robe fund and give it to nun so-and-so,’

pli-tv-bi-pm:57.3.pli: So ce dūto taṃ bhikkhuniṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya:
pli-tv-bi-pm:57.3.eng: and the messenger goes to that nun and says,

pli-tv-bi-pm:57.4.pli: “idaṃ kho, ayye, ayyaṃ uddissa cīvaracetāpannaṃ ābhataṃ, paṭiggaṇhātāyyā cīvaracetāpanna”nti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:57.4.eng: ‘Venerable, I have brought a robe fund for you. Please receive it,’

pli-tv-bi-pm:57.5.pli: Tāya bhikkhuniyā so dūto evamassa vacanīyo:

pli-tv-bi-pm:57.6.pli: “na kho mayaṃ, āvuso, cīvaracetāpannaṃ paṭiggaṇhāma, cīvarañca kho mayaṃ paṭiggaṇhāma kālena kappiya”nti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:57.6.eng: ‘We don’t receive robe funds, but we do receive allowable robe-cloth at the right time.’

pli-tv-bi-pm:57.7.pli: So ce dūto taṃ bhikkhuniṃ evaṃ vadeyya:

pli-tv-bi-pm:57.8.eng: ‘Is there anyone who provides services for you?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:57.9.pli: cīvaratthikāya, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyā veyyāvaccakaro niddisitabbo ārāmiko vā upāsako vā:
pli-tv-bi-pm:57.9.eng: the nun, if she needs robe-cloth, should point out a monastery worker or a lay follower and say,

pli-tv-bi-pm:57.10.eng: ‘That person provides services for the nuns.’

pli-tv-bi-pm:57.11.pli: So ce dūto taṃ veyyāvaccakaraṃ saññāpetvā taṃ bhikkhuniṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya:
pli-tv-bi-pm:57.11.eng: If the messenger instructs that service provider and then returns to the nun and says,

pli-tv-bi-pm:57.12.pli: “yaṃ kho, ayye, ayyā veyyāvaccakaraṃ niddisi, saññatto so mayā, upasaṅkamatāyyā kālena, cīvarena taṃ acchādessatī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:57.12.eng: ‘Venerable, I have instructed the service provider you pointed out. Please go to them at the right time and he’ll give you robe-cloth,’

pli-tv-bi-pm:57.13.pli: Cīvaratthikāya, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyā veyyāvaccakaro upasaṅkamitvā dvattikkhattuṃ codetabbo sāretabbo:
pli-tv-bi-pm:57.13.eng: then, if that nun needs robe-cloth, she should go to that service provider and prompt and remind them two or three times, saying,

pli-tv-bi-pm:57.15.pli: dvattikkhattuṃ codayamānā sārayamānā taṃ cīvaraṃ abhinipphādeyya, iccetaṃ kusalaṃ,
pli-tv-bi-pm:57.15.eng: If she then gets robe-cloth, all is well.

pli-tv-bi-pm:57.16.pli: no ce abhinipphādeyya, catukkhattuṃ pañcakkhattuṃ chakkhattuparamaṃ tuṇhībhūtāya uddissa ṭhātabbaṃ,
pli-tv-bi-pm:57.16.eng: If she does not get it, she should stand in silence for it at most six times.

pli-tv-bi-pm:57.17.pli: catukkhattuṃ pañcakkhattuṃ chakkhattuparamaṃ tuṇhībhūtā uddissa tiṭṭhamānā taṃ cīvaraṃ abhinipphādeyya, iccetaṃ kusalaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:57.17.eng: If she then gets robe-cloth, all is well.

pli-tv-bi-pm:57.18.pli: Tato ce uttari vāyamamānā taṃ cīvaraṃ abhinipphādeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:57.18.eng: If she makes any further effort and then gets robe-cloth, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:57.19.pli: No ce abhinipphādeyya, yatassā cīvaracetāpannaṃ ābhataṃ, tattha sāmaṃ vā gantabbaṃ, dūto vā pāhetabbo:
pli-tv-bi-pm:57.19.eng: If she does not get robe-cloth, she should go to the owners of that robe fund, or send a message, saying,

pli-tv-bi-pm:57.20.pli: “yaṃ kho tumhe āyasmanto bhikkhuniṃ uddissa cīvaracetāpannaṃ pahiṇittha, na taṃ tassā bhikkhuniyā kiñci atthaṃ anubhoti,
pli-tv-bi-pm:57.20.eng: ‘That nun hasn’t received any benefit from the robe fund you sent for her.

pli-tv-bi-pm:57.21.pli: yuñjantāyasmanto sakaṃ, mā vo sakaṃ vinassā”ti,
pli-tv-bi-pm:57.21.eng: Please recover what’s yours, or it might perish.’

pli-tv-bi-pm:57.23.eng: The subchapter on robes is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:58.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī jātarūparajataṃ uggaṇheyya vā uggaṇhāpeyya vā upanikkhittaṃ vā sādiyeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:58.1.eng: If a nun takes, has someone else take, or consents to gold and silver being deposited for her, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:59.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 22: trading with money

pli-tv-bi-pm:59.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī nānappakārakaṃ rūpiyasaṃvohāraṃ samāpajjeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:59.1.eng: If a nun engages in various kinds of trades involving money, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:60.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī nānappakārakaṃ kayavikkayaṃ samāpajjeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:60.1.eng: If a nun engages in various kinds of barter, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’

pli-tv-bi-pm:61.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 24: exchanging an almsbowl with fewer than five mends

pli-tv-bi-pm:61.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī ūnapañcabandhanena pattena aññaṃ navaṃ pattaṃ cetāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:61.1.eng: If a nun exchanges an almsbowl with fewer than five mends for a new almsbowl, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:61.2.pli: Tāya bhikkhuniyā so patto bhikkhuniparisāya nissajjitabbo,
pli-tv-bi-pm:61.2.eng: That nun should relinquish that almsbowl to a gathering of nuns.

pli-tv-bi-pm:61.3.pli: yo ca tassā bhikkhuniparisāya pattapariyanto, so tassā bhikkhuniyā padātabbo:
pli-tv-bi-pm:61.3.eng: She should then be given the last almsbowl belonging to that gathering:

pli-tv-bi-pm:61.4.pli: “ayaṃ te bhikkhuni patto yāvabhedanāya dhāretabbo”ti, ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.
pli-tv-bi-pm:61.4.eng: ‘Nun, this bowl is yours. Keep it until it breaks.’

pli-tv-bi-pm:62.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 25: storing the five tonics too long

pli-tv-bi-pm:62.1.pli: Yāni kho pana tāni gilānānaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ paṭisāyanīyāni bhesajjāni, seyyathidaṃ: sappi navanītaṃ telaṃ madhu phāṇitaṃ, tāni paṭiggahetvā sattāhaparamaṃ sannidhikārakaṃ paribhuñjitabbāni.
pli-tv-bi-pm:62.1.eng: After being received, the tonics allowable for sick nuns—that is, ghee, butter, oil, honey, and syrup: should be used from storage for at most seven days.

pli-tv-bi-pm:62.2.eng: If she keeps it longer than that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:63.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 26: taking back robe-cloth in anger

pli-tv-bi-pm:63.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā sāmaṃ cīvaraṃ datvā kupitā anattamanā acchindeyya vā acchindāpeyya vā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:63.1.eng: If a nun herself gives a robe to a nun, but then, in anger, takes it back or has it taken back, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:64.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 27: asking for thread

pli-tv-bi-pm:64.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī sāmaṃ suttaṃ viññāpetvā tantavāyehi cīvaraṃ vāyāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:64.1.eng: If a nun herself asks for thread, and then has weavers weave her robe-cloth, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:65.1.pli: Bhikkhuniṃ paneva uddissa aññātako gahapati vā gahapatānī vā tantavāyehi cīvaraṃ vāyāpeyya, tatra cesā bhikkhunī pubbe appavāritā tantavāye upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjeyya:
pli-tv-bi-pm:65.1.eng: If a male or female householder is having robe-cloth woven by weavers for an unrelated nun and, without first being invited, that nun goes to those weavers and specifies the kind of robe-cloth she wants, saying,

pli-tv-bi-pm:65.2.pli: “idaṃ kho āvuso cīvaraṃ maṃ uddissa viyyati, āyatañca karotha, vitthatañca appitañca suvītañca suppavāyitañca suvilekhitañca suvitacchitañca karotha,
pli-tv-bi-pm:65.2.eng: ‘This robe-cloth that you are weaving for me, make it long and wide; make it closely woven, well-woven, well-stretched, well-scraped, and well-combed,

pli-tv-bi-pm:65.3.pli: appeva nāma mayampi āyasmantānaṃ kiñcimattaṃ anupadajjeyyāmā”ti,
pli-tv-bi-pm:65.3.eng: and perhaps I will even give you a small gift,’

pli-tv-bi-pm:65.4.pli: evañca sā bhikkhunī vatvā kiñcimattaṃ anupadajjeyya antamaso piṇḍapātamattampi, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:65.4.eng: then, in saying that and afterwards giving them a small gift, even a bit of almsfood, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:66.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 29: storing haste-cloth too long

pli-tv-bi-pm:66.1.pli: Dasāhānāgataṃ kattikatemāsikapuṇṇamaṃ bhikkhuniyā paneva accekacīvaraṃ uppajjeyya, accekaṃ maññamānāya bhikkhuniyā paṭiggahetabbaṃ, paṭiggahetvā yāva cīvarakālasamayaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:66.1.eng: When there are ten days left to the Kattika full moon that ends the first rainy-season residence and haste-cloth is given to a nun, she may receive it if she regards it as urgent. She may then store it until the end of the robe season.

pli-tv-bi-pm:66.2.pli: Tato ce uttari nikkhipeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:66.2.eng: If she stores it beyond that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:67.0.eng: Relinquishment and confession 30: diverting an offering intended for the Sangha

pli-tv-bi-pm:67.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī jānaṃ saṅghikaṃ lābhaṃ pariṇataṃ attano pariṇāmeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:67.1.eng: If a nun diverts to herself material support that she knows was intended for the Sangha, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:67.2.eng: The subchapter on bowls is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:68.1.pli: Uddiṭṭhā kho, ayyāyo, tiṃsa nissaggiyā pācittiyā dhammā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:68.1.eng: Venerables, the thirty rules on relinquishment and confession have been recited.

pli-tv-bi-pm:68.2.eng: In regard to this I ask you, ‘Are you pure in this?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:68.3.eng: A second time I ask, ‘Are you pure in this?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:68.4.eng: A third time I ask, ‘Are you pure in this?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:68.5.eng: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’

pli-tv-bi-pm:68.6.eng: The offenses entailing relinquishment and confession are finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:69.1.pli: Ime kho panāyyāyo, chasaṭṭhisatā pācittiyā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:69.1.eng: Venerables, these hundred and sixty-six rules on confession come up for recitation.

pli-tv-bi-pm:70.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī lasuṇaṃ khādeyya pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:70.1.eng: If a nun eats garlic, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:71.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī sambādhe lomaṃ saṃharāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:71.1.eng: If a nun removes hair from her private parts, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:72.1.eng: If a nun slaps her genitals with the palm of her hand, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:73.1.eng: If a nun uses a dildo, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:74.1.pli: Udakasuddhikaṃ pana bhikkhuniyā ādiyamānāya dvaṅgulapabbaparamaṃ ādātabbaṃ. Taṃ atikkāmentiyā pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:74.1.eng: If a nun is cleaning herself with water, she may insert two finger joints at the most. If she goes further than that, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:75.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhussa bhuñjantassa pānīyena vā vidhūpanena vā upatiṭṭheyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:75.1.eng: If, when a monk is eating, a nun attends on him with drinking water or a fan, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:76.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī āmakadhaññaṃ viññatvā vā viññāpetvā vā bhajjitvā vā bhajjāpetvā vā koṭṭetvā vā koṭṭāpetvā vā pacitvā vā pacāpetvā vā bhuñjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:76.1.eng: If a nun asks for or has someone else ask for raw grain, or she roasts it or has it roasted, or she pounds it or has it pounded, or she cooks it or has it cooked, and she then eats it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:77.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā saṅkāraṃ vā vighāsaṃ vā tirokuṭṭe vā tiropākāre vā chaḍḍeyya vā chaḍḍāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:77.1.eng: If a nun disposes of feces or urine or trash or food scraps over a wall or over an encircling wall, or she has it disposed of in this way, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:78.0.eng: Confession 9: disposing of waste on plants

pli-tv-bi-pm:78.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā saṅkāraṃ vā vighāsaṃ vā harite chaḍḍeyya vā chaḍḍāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:78.1.eng: If a nun disposes of feces or urine or trash or food scraps on cultivated plants, or she has it disposed of in this way, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:79.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī naccaṃ vā gītaṃ vā vāditaṃ vā dassanāya gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:79.1.eng: If a nun goes to see dancing or singing or music, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:79.2.eng: The subchapter on garlic is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:80.0.2.eng: Confession 11: meeting a man in the dark

pli-tv-bi-pm:80.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī rattandhakāre appadīpe purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā santiṭṭheyya vā sallapeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:80.1.eng: If, in the dark of the night without a lamp, a nun stands or talks alone with a man, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:81.0.eng: Confession 12: meeting a man in a concealed place

pli-tv-bi-pm:81.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī paṭicchanne okāse purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā santiṭṭheyya vā sallapeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:81.1.eng: If a nun stands or talks alone with a man in a concealed place, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:82.0.eng: Confession 13: meeting a man in the open

pli-tv-bi-pm:82.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī ajjhokāse purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā santiṭṭheyya vā sallapeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:82.1.eng: If a nun stands or talks alone with a man out in the open, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:83.0.eng: Confession 14: meeting a man on a street

pli-tv-bi-pm:83.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī rathikāya vā byūhe vā siṅghāṭake vā purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā santiṭṭheyya vā sallapeyya vā nikaṇṇikaṃ vā jappeyya dutiyikaṃ vā bhikkhuniṃ uyyojeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:83.1.eng: If a nun stands or talks alone with a man on a street or in a cul-de-sac or at an intersection, or she whispers in his ear or dismisses her companion nun, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:84.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī purebhattaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamitvā āsane nisīditvā sāmike anāpucchā pakkameyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:84.1.eng: If a nun visits families before the meal, sits down on a seat, and then departs without informing the owners, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:85.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī pacchābhattaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamitvā sāmike anāpucchā āsane abhinisīdeyya vā abhinipajjeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:85.1.eng: If a nun visits families after the meal, and then sits down or lies down on a seat without asking permission of the owners, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:86.0.eng: Confession 17: laying out bedding without permission

pli-tv-bi-pm:86.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī vikāle kulāni upasaṅkamitvā sāmike anāpucchā seyyaṃ santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā abhinisīdeyya vā abhinipajjeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:86.1.eng: If a nun visits families at the wrong time, puts out bedding without asking permission of the owners, or has it put out, and then sits down or lies down on it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:87.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī duggahitena dūpadhāritena paraṃ ujjhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:87.1.eng: If a nun complains about someone because of a misunderstanding and a lack of proper reflection, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:88.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī attānaṃ vā paraṃ vā nirayena vā brahmacariyena vā abhisapeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:88.1.eng: If a nun curses herself or someone else, referring to hell or the spiritual life, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:89.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī attānaṃ vadhitvā vadhitvā rodeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:89.1.eng: If a nun cries after repeatedly beating herself, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:89.2.eng: The second subchapter on dark of the night is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:90.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī naggā nahāyeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:90.1.eng: If a nun bathes naked, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:91.1.pli: Udakasāṭikaṃ pana bhikkhuniyā kārayamānāya pamāṇikā kāretabbā, tatridaṃ pamāṇaṃ, dīghaso catasso vidatthiyo sugatavidatthiyā, tiriyaṃ dve vidatthiyo. Taṃ atikkāmentiyā chedanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:91.1.eng: If a nun is having a bathing robe made, it should be made the right size. This is the right size: four standard handspans long and two wide. If it exceeds that, it is to be cut down, and she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:92.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ visibbetvā vā visibbāpetvā vā sā pacchā anantarāyikinī neva sibbeyya, na sibbāpanāya ussukkaṃ kareyya aññatra catūhapañcāhā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:92.1.eng: If a nun, after unstitching a nun’s robe or having it unstitched, neither sews it herself nor makes any effort to have someone else sew it, then, if there was no obstruction or it was no more than four or five days, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:93.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī pañcāhikaṃ saṅghāṭicāraṃ atikkāmeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:93.1.eng: If a nun does not move her robes for more than five days, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:94.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī cīvarasaṅkamanīyaṃ dhāreyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:94.1.eng: If a nun wears a robe taken on loan, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:95.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī gaṇassa cīvaralābhaṃ antarāyaṃ kareyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:95.1.eng: If a nun creates an obstacle for a group to get robe-cloth, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:96.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī dhammikaṃ cīvaravibhaṅgaṃ paṭibāheyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:96.1.eng: If a nun blocks a legitimate distribution of robe-cloth, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:97.0.eng: Confession 28: giving a robe to a non-monastic

pli-tv-bi-pm:97.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī agārikassa vā paribbājakassa vā paribbājikāya vā samaṇacīvaraṃ dadeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:97.1.eng: If a nun gives a monastic robe to a householder or a male wanderer or a female wanderer, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:98.0.eng: Confession 29: letting the robe season expire

pli-tv-bi-pm:98.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī dubbalacīvarapaccāsāya cīvarakālasamayaṃ atikkāmeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:98.1.eng: If a nun lets the robe season expire because of an uncertain expectation of robe-cloth, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:99.0.eng: Confession 30: blocking the ending of the robe season

pli-tv-bi-pm:99.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī dhammikaṃ kathinuddhāraṃ paṭibāheyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:99.1.eng: If a nun blocks a legitimate ending of the robe season, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:99.2.eng: The third subchapter on nakedness is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:100.0.2.eng: Confession 31: lying on the same bed

pli-tv-bi-pm:100.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhuniyo dve ekamañce tuvaṭṭeyyuṃ, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:100.1.eng: If two nuns lie down on the same bed, they commit an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:101.0.eng: Confession 32: lying on the same sheet

pli-tv-bi-pm:101.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhuniyo dve ekattharaṇapāvuraṇā tuvaṭṭeyyuṃ, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:101.1.eng: If two nuns lie down on the same sheet and under the same cover, they commit an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:102.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā sañcicca aphāsuṃ kareyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:102.1.eng: If a nun intentionally makes a nun ill at ease, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:103.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī dukkhitaṃ sahajīviniṃ neva upaṭṭhaheyya, na upaṭṭhāpanāya ussukkaṃ kareyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:103.1.eng: If a nun neither nurses a suffering disciple, nor makes any effort to have someone else nurse her, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:104.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā upassayaṃ datvā kupitā anattamanā nikkaḍḍheyya vā nikkaḍḍhāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:104.1.eng: If a nun gives a dwelling place to a nun, and then, in anger, throws her out or has her thrown out, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:105.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī saṃsaṭṭhā vihareyya gahapatinā vā gahapatiputtena vā, sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi evamassa vacanīyā:
pli-tv-bi-pm:105.1.eng: If a nun is socializing with a householder or a householder’s offspring, the nuns should correct her like this:

pli-tv-bi-pm:105.2.pli: “māyye, saṃsaṭṭhā vihari gahapatināpi gahapatiputtenāpi, viviccāyye, vivekaññeva bhaginiyā saṅgho vaṇṇetī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:105.2.eng: ‘Venerable, don’t socialize with householders or householders’ offspring. Be secluded, Venerable. The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters.’

pli-tv-bi-pm:105.3.pli: Evañca sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi vuccamānā tatheva paggaṇheyya, sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsitabbā tassa paṭinissaggāya,
pli-tv-bi-pm:105.3.eng: If that nun continues as before, the nuns should press her up to three times to make her stop.

pli-tv-bi-pm:105.4.pli: yāvatatiyañce samanubhāsiyamānā taṃ paṭinissajjeyya, iccetaṃ kusalaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:105.4.eng: If she then stops, all is well.

pli-tv-bi-pm:105.5.eng: If she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:106.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī antoraṭṭhe sāsaṅkasammate sappaṭibhaye asatthikā cārikaṃ careyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:106.1.eng: If a nun goes wandering without a group of travelers where it is considered risky and dangerous within her own country, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:107.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī tiroraṭṭhe sāsaṅkasammate sappaṭibhaye asatthikā cārikaṃ careyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:107.1.eng: If a nun goes wandering without a group of travelers where it is considered risky and dangerous outside her own country, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:108.0.eng: Confession 39: wandering during the rainy season

pli-tv-bi-pm:108.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī antovassaṃ cārikaṃ careyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:108.1.eng: If a nun goes wandering during the rainy season, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:109.0.eng: Confession 40: not wandering after the rainy season

pli-tv-bi-pm:109.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī vassaṃvuṭṭhā cārikaṃ na pakkameyya antamaso chappañcayojanānipi, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:109.1.eng: If a nun who has completed the rainy-season residence does not go wandering at least 65 to 80 kilometers, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:109.2.eng: The fourth subchapter on lying down is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:110.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī rājāgāraṃ vā cittāgāraṃ vā ārāmaṃ vā uyyānaṃ vā pokkharaṇiṃ vā dassanāya gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:110.1.eng: If a nun visits a royal house or a gallery or a park or a garden or a lotus pond, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:111.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī āsandiṃ vā pallaṅkaṃ vā paribhuñjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:111.1.eng: If a nun uses a high or luxurious couch, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:112.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī suttaṃ kanteyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:112.1.eng: If a nun spins yarn, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:113.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī gihiveyyāvaccaṃ kareyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:113.1.eng: If a nun provides services for a householder, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:114.0.eng: Confession 45: not resolving a legal issue

pli-tv-bi-pm:114.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā: “ehāyye, imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasamehī”ti vuccamānā: “sādhū”ti paṭissuṇitvā sā pacchā anantarāyikinī neva vūpasameyya, na vūpasamāya ussukkaṃ kareyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:114.1.eng: If, when asked by a nun, a nun consents to resolve a legal issue, but then neither resolves it nor makes any effort to resolve it, then, if there was no obstruction, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:115.0.eng: Confession 46: giving food to a non-monastic

pli-tv-bi-pm:115.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī agārikassa vā paribbājakassa vā paribbājikāya vā sahatthā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā dadeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:115.1.eng: If a nun personally gives fresh or cooked food to a householder or a male wanderer or a female wanderer, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:116.0.eng: Confession 47: not relinquishing a monastery robe

pli-tv-bi-pm:116.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī āvasathacīvaraṃ anissajjetvā paribhuñjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:116.1.eng: If a nun does not relinquish a monastery robe, but continues to use it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:117.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī āvasathaṃ anissajjitvā cārikaṃ pakkameyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:117.1.eng: If a nun goes wandering without relinquishing her lodging, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:118.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī tiracchānavijjaṃ pariyāpuṇeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:118.1.eng: If a nun studies worldly subjects, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:119.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī tiracchānavijjaṃ vāceyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:119.1.eng: If a nun teaches worldly subjects, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:119.2.eng: The fifth subchapter on galleries is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:120.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī jānaṃ sabhikkhukaṃ ārāmaṃ anāpucchā paviseyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:120.1.eng: If a nun, knowing that there are monks in a monastery, enters it without asking permission, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:121.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuṃ akkoseyya vā paribhāseyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:121.1.eng: If a nun abuses or reviles a monk, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:122.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī caṇḍīkatā gaṇaṃ paribhāseyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:122.1.eng: If a furious nun reviles a community, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:123.0.eng: Confession 54: eating more after refusing an offer

pli-tv-bi-pm:123.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī nimantitā vā pavāritā vā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:123.1.eng: If a nun, who has been invited to a meal, refuses an offer to eat more, and then eats fresh or cooked food, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:124.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī kulamaccharinī assa, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:124.1.eng: If a nun is keeps a family to herself, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:125.0.eng: Confession 56: spending the rainy season apart from monks

pli-tv-bi-pm:125.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī abhikkhuke āvāse vassaṃ vaseyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:125.1.eng: If a nun spends the rainy-season residence in a monastery without monks, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:126.0.eng: Confession 57: not doing the invitation ceremony

pli-tv-bi-pm:126.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī vassaṃvuṭṭhā ubhatosaṅghe tīhi ṭhānehi na pavāreyya diṭṭhena vā sutena vā parisaṅkāya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:126.1.eng: If a nun who has completed the rainy-season residence does not invite correction from both Sanghas in regard to three things—what has been seen, what has been heard, or what has been suspected—she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:127.0.eng: Confession 58: not going to the instruction

pli-tv-bi-pm:127.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī ovādāya vā saṃvāsāya vā na gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:127.1.eng: If a nun does not go to the instruction or take part in a formal meeting of the community, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:128.1.pli: Anvaddhamāsaṃ bhikkhuniyā bhikkhusaṅghato dve dhammā paccāsīsitabbā uposathapucchakañca ovādūpasaṅkamanañca. Taṃ atikkāmentiyā pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:128.1.eng: Every half-month a nun should seek two things from the Sangha of monks: asking it about the observance day and going to it for the instruction. If she lets the half-month pass, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:129.0.eng: Confession 60: getting medical treatment by a man

pli-tv-bi-pm:129.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī pasākhe jātaṃ gaṇḍaṃ vā rudhitaṃ vā anapaloketvā saṅghaṃ vā gaṇaṃ vā purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā bhedāpeyya vā phālāpeyya vā dhovāpeyya vā ālimpāpeyya vā bandhāpeyya vā mocāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:129.1.eng: If a nun, alone with a man, without getting permission from the Sangha or a group, has an abscess or a wound situated on the lower part of her body ruptured by him, or split open, washed, anointed, bandaged, or unwrapped by him, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:129.2.eng: The sixth subchapter on monasteries is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:130.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī gabbhiniṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:130.1.eng: If a nun gives the full admission to a pregnant woman, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:131.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī pāyantiṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:131.1.eng: If a nun gives the full admission to a woman who is breastfeeding, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:132.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī dve vassāni chasu dhammesu asikkhitasikkhaṃ sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:132.1.eng: If a nun gives the full admission to a trainee nun who has not trained for two years in the six rules, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:133.0.eng: Confession 64: ordaining a trained candidate without approval

pli-tv-bi-pm:133.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhaṃ sikkhamānaṃ saṅghena asammataṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:133.1.eng: If a nun gives the full admission to a trainee nun who has trained for two years in the six rules, but who has not been approved by the Sangha, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:134.0.eng: Confession 65: ordaining a married girl under twelve

pli-tv-bi-pm:134.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī ūnadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:134.1.eng: If a nun gives the full admission to a married girl who is less than twelve years old, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:135.0.eng: Confession 66: ordaining an untrained married girl

pli-tv-bi-pm:135.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī paripuṇṇadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu asikkhitasikkhaṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:135.1.eng: If a nun gives the full admission to a married girl who is more than twelve years old, but who has not trained for two years in the six rules, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:136.0.eng: Confession 67: ordaining a trained married girl without approval

pli-tv-bi-pm:136.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī paripuṇṇadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhaṃ saṅghena asammataṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:136.1.eng: If a nun gives the full admission to a married girl who is more than twelve years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules, but who has not been approved by the Sangha, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:137.0.eng: Confession 68: not guiding a disciple after ordination

pli-tv-bi-pm:137.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī sahajīviniṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā dve vassāni neva anuggaṇheyya na anuggaṇhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:137.1.eng: If a nun gives the full admission to a disciple, and then, for the next two years, neither guides her nor has her guided, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:138.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī vuṭṭhāpitaṃ pavattiniṃ dve vassāni nānubandheyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:138.1.eng: If a nun does not follow the mentor who gave her the full admission for two years, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:139.0.eng: Confession 70: not sending away a new disciple

pli-tv-bi-pm:139.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī sahajīviniṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā neva vūpakāseyya na vūpakāsāpeyya antamaso chappañcayojanānipi, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:139.1.eng: If a nun gives the full admission to a disciple, and then neither sends her away nor has her sent away at least 65 to 80 kilometers, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:139.2.eng: The seventh subchapter on pregnant women is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:140.0.2.eng: Confession 71: ordaining a married girl under twenty

pli-tv-bi-pm:140.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī ūnavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:140.1.eng: If a nun gives the full admission to an unmarried girl who is less than twenty years old, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:141.0.eng: Confession 72: ordaining an untrained unmarried girl

pli-tv-bi-pm:141.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī paripuṇṇavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu asikkhitasikkhaṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:141.1.eng: If a nun gives the full admission to an unmarried girl who is more than twenty years old, but who has not trained for two years in the six rules, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:142.0.eng: Confession 73: ordaining a trained unmarried girl without approval

pli-tv-bi-pm:142.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī paripuṇṇavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhaṃ saṅghena asammataṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:142.1.eng: If a nun gives the full admission to an unmarried girl who is more than twenty years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules, but who has not been approved by the Sangha, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:143.0.eng: Confession 74: giving ordination while under twelve years’ seniority

pli-tv-bi-pm:143.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī ūnadvādasavassā vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:143.1.eng: If a nun who has less than twelve years of seniority gives the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:144.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī paripuṇṇadvādasavassā saṅghena asammatā vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:144.1.eng: If a nun who has twelve years of seniority gives the full admission without approval from the Sangha, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:145.0.eng: Confession 76: agreeing to stop ordaining, but then criticizing

pli-tv-bi-pm:145.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī, “alaṃ tāva te, ayye, vuṭṭhāpitenā”ti vuccamānā, “sādhū”ti paṭissuṇitvā sā pacchā khiyyanadhammaṃ āpajjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:145.1.eng: If a nun is told, ‘Venerable, you have given enough full admissions for now,’ and she consents, saying, ‘Fine,’ but then criticizes it afterwards, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:146.0.eng: Confession 77: not ordaining a trainee after promising

pli-tv-bi-pm:146.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī sikkhamānaṃ, “sace me tvaṃ, ayye, cīvaraṃ dassasi, evāhaṃ taṃ vuṭṭhāpessāmī”ti vatvā sā pacchā anantarāyikinī neva vuṭṭhāpeyya, na vuṭṭhāpanāya ussukkaṃ kareyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:146.1.eng: If a nun tells a trainee nun, If you give me a robe, Venerable, I’ll give you the full admission,’ but she then neither gives her the full admission nor makes any effort to have her fully admitted, then, if there was no obstruction, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:147.0.eng: Confession 78: not ordaining a trainee who has followed

pli-tv-bi-pm:147.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī sikkhamānaṃ, “sace maṃ tvaṃ, ayye, dve vassāni anubandhissasi, evāhaṃ taṃ vuṭṭhāpessāmī”ti vatvā sā pacchā anantarāyikinī neva vuṭṭhāpeyya, na vuṭṭhāpanāya ussukkaṃ kareyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:147.1.eng: If a nun tells a trainee nun, If you follow me for two years, Venerable, I’ll give you the full admission,’ but she then neither gives her the full admission nor makes any effort to have her fully admitted, then, if there was no obstruction, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:148.0.eng: Confession 79: ordaining one who is difficult to live with

pli-tv-bi-pm:148.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī purisasaṃsaṭṭhaṃ kumārakasaṃsaṭṭhaṃ caṇḍiṃ sokāvāsaṃ sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:148.1.eng: If a nun gives the full admission to a trainee nun who is socializing with men and boys and who is temperamental and difficult to live with, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:149.0.eng: Confession 80: ordaining without permission from parents

pli-tv-bi-pm:149.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī mātāpitūhi vā sāmikena vā ananuññātaṃ sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:149.1.eng: If a nun gives the full admission to a trainee nun who has not been given permission by her parents or her husband, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:150.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī pārivāsikachandadānena sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:150.1.eng: If, when a given consent has expired, a nun gives the full admission to a trainee nun, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:151.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī anuvassaṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:151.1.eng: If a nun gives full admission every year, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:152.0.eng: Confession 83: ordaining two in one year

pli-tv-bi-pm:152.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī ekaṃ vassaṃ dve vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:152.1.eng: If a nun gives the full admission to two women in one year, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:152.2.eng: The eighth subchapter on unmarried girls is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:153.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī agilānā chattupāhanaṃ dhāreyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:153.1.eng: If a nun who is not sick uses a sunshade and sandals, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:154.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī agilānā yānena yāyeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:154.1.eng: If a nun who is not sick travels in a vehicle, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:155.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī saṅghāṇiṃ dhāreyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:155.1.eng: If a nun wears a hip ornament, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:156.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī itthālaṅkāraṃ dhāreyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:156.1.eng: If a nun wears jewelry, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:157.0.eng: Confession 88: bathing in scents and colors

pli-tv-bi-pm:157.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī gandhavaṇṇakena nahāyeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:157.1.eng: If a nun bathes with scents and colors, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:158.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī vāsitakena piññākena nahāyeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:158.1.eng: If a nun bathes with scented sesame paste, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:159.0.eng: Confession 90: getting a massage from a nun

pli-tv-bi-pm:159.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā ummaddāpeyya vā parimaddāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:159.1.eng: If a nun has a nun massage her or rub her, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:160.0.eng: Confession 91: getting a massage from a trainee nun

pli-tv-bi-pm:160.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī sikkhamānāya ummaddāpeyya vā parimaddāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:160.1.eng: If a nun has a trainee nun massage her or rub her, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:161.0.eng: Confession 92: getting a massage from a novice nun

pli-tv-bi-pm:161.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī sāmaṇeriyā ummaddāpeyya vā parimaddāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:161.1.eng: If a nun has a novice nun massage her or rub her, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:162.0.eng: Confession 93: getting a massage from a lay woman

pli-tv-bi-pm:162.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī gihiniyā ummaddāpeyya vā parimaddāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:162.1.eng: If a nun has a female householder massage her or rub her, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:163.0.eng: Confession 94: sitting in front without permission

pli-tv-bi-pm:163.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhussa purato anāpucchā āsane nisīdeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:163.1.eng: If a nun sits down on a seat in front of a monk without asking permission, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:164.0.eng: Confession 95: asking a question without permission

pli-tv-bi-pm:164.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī anokāsakataṃ bhikkhuṃ pañhaṃ puccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:164.1.eng: If a nun asks a question of a monk who has not given her permission, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:165.0.eng: Confession 96: not wearing a chest wraps

pli-tv-bi-pm:165.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī asaṅkaccikā gāmaṃ paviseyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:165.1.eng: If a nun enters an inhabited area without wearing her chest wrap, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:165.2.eng: The nineth subchapter on sunshades and sandals is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:166.1.eng: If a nun lies in full awareness, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:167.1.eng: If a nun speaks abusively, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:168.1.eng: If a nun engages in malicious talebearing between nuns, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:169.0.eng: Confession 100: instructing to memorize the Teaching

pli-tv-bi-pm:169.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī anupasampannaṃ padaso dhammaṃ vāceyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:169.1.eng: If a nun instructs a person who is not fully ordained to memorize the Teaching, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:170.0.eng: Confession 101: lying down with an unordained woman

pli-tv-bi-pm:170.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī anupasampannāya uttaridirattatirattaṃ sahaseyyaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:170.1.eng: If a nun lies down more than two or three nights in the same sleeping place as a woman who is not fully ordained, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:171.0.eng: Confession 102: lying down with a man

pli-tv-bi-pm:171.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī purisena sahaseyyaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:171.1.eng: If a nun lies down in the same sleeping place as a man, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:172.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī purisassa uttarichappañcavācāhi dhammaṃ deseyya aññatra viññunā itthiviggahena, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:172.1.eng: If a nun gives a teaching of more than five or six sentences to a man, except in the presence of a woman who understands, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:173.0.eng: Confession 104: truthfully announcing a superhuman attainment

pli-tv-bi-pm:173.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī anupasampannāya uttarimanussadhammaṃ āroceyya, bhūtasmiṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:173.1.eng: If a nun truthfully tells a person who is not fully ordained of a superhuman quality, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:174.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā duṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ anupasampannāya āroceyya aññatra bhikkhunisammutiyā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:174.1.eng: If a nun tells a person who is not fully ordained about a nun’s grave offense, except if the nuns have agreed, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:175.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī pathaviṃ khaṇeyya vā khaṇāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:175.1.eng: If a nun digs the earth or has it dug, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:175.2.eng: The first subchapter on lying is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:176.1.eng: If a nun destroys plants, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:177.1.eng: If a nun speaks evasively or harasses, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:178.1.eng: If a nun complains or criticizes, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:179.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī saṅghikaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā bhisiṃ vā kocchaṃ vā ajjhokāse santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamantī neva uddhareyya, na uddharāpeyya, anāpucchaṃ vā gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:179.1.eng: If a nun takes a bed, a bench, a mattress, or a stool belonging to the Sangha and puts it outside or has it put outside, and she then departs without putting it away, having it put away, or informing anyone, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:180.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī saṅghike vihāre seyyaṃ santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamantī neva uddhareyya, na uddharāpeyya, anāpucchaṃ vā gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.
