pli-tv-bi-pm:180.1.eng: If a nun puts out bedding in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, or has it put out, and she then departs without putting it away, having it put away, or informing anyone, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:181.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī saṅghike vihāre jānaṃ pubbupagataṃ bhikkhuniṃ anupakhajja seyyaṃ kappeyya, “yassā sambādho bhavissati, sā pakkamissatī”ti etadeva paccayaṃ karitvā anaññaṃ, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:181.1.eng: If, in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, a nun arranges her sleeping place in a way that encroaches on a nun that she knows arrived there before her, with the intention that anyone who feels crowded will leave, and she does so only for this reason and no other, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:182.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniṃ kupitā anattamanā saṅghikā vihārā nikkaḍḍheyya vā nikkaḍḍhāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:182.1.eng: If a nun, in anger, throws a nun out of a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, or has her thrown out, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:183.0.eng: Confession 114: sitting down on an upper story

pli-tv-bi-pm:183.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī saṅghike vihāre uparivehāsakuṭiyā āhaccapādakaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā abhinisīdeyya vā abhinipajjeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:183.1.eng: If a nun sits down or lies down on a bed or a bench with detachable legs on an upper story in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:184.0.eng: Confession 115: applying excessive materials to a large dwelling

pli-tv-bi-pm:184.1.pli: Mahallakaṃ pana bhikkhuniyā vihāraṃ kārayamānāya yāva dvārakosā aggaḷaṭṭhapanāya, ālokasandhiparikammāya dvatticchadanassa pariyāyaṃ appaharite ṭhitāya adhiṭṭhātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:184.1.eng: When a nun is building a large dwelling, then standing where there are no cultivated plants, she may apply two or three courses of roofing material, taking it as far as the doorcase and using it for fixing the door and for treating the window openings.

pli-tv-bi-pm:184.2.pli: Tato ce uttari appaharitepi ṭhitā adhiṭṭhaheyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:184.2.eng: If she applies more than that, even if she stands where there are no cultivated plants, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:185.0.eng: Confession 116: using water with living creatures

pli-tv-bi-pm:185.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī jānaṃ sappāṇakaṃ udakaṃ tiṇaṃ vā mattikaṃ vā siñceyya vā siñcāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:185.1.eng: If a nun pours water that she knows contains living beings onto grass or clay, or has it poured, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:185.2.eng: The eleventh subchapter on plants is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:186.0.2.eng: Confession 117: eating excessively at a public guesthouse

pli-tv-bi-pm:186.1.eng: If a nun who is not sick eats more than one almsmeal at a public guesthouse,

pli-tv-bi-pm:186.2.eng: she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:187.1.eng: If a nun eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:187.2.pli: Tatthāyaṃ samayo, gilānasamayo, cīvaradānasamayo , cīvarakārasamayo, addhānagamanasamayo, nāvābhiruhanasamayo, mahāsamayo, samaṇabhattasamayo, ayaṃ tattha samayo.
pli-tv-bi-pm:187.2.eng: These are the appropriate occasions: she is sick; it is the robe-giving season; it is a time of making robes; she is traveling; she is on a boat; it is a big occasion; it is a meal given by a monastic.

pli-tv-bi-pm:188.0.eng: Confession 119: accepting more than three bowlfuls

pli-tv-bi-pm:188.1.pli: Bhikkhuniṃ paneva kulaṃ upagataṃ pūvehi vā manthehi vā abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavāreyya, ākaṅkhamānāya bhikkhuniyā dvattipattapūrā paṭiggahetabbā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:188.1.eng: If a nun goes to a family and is invited to take pastries or baked goods, she may accept two or three bowlfuls if she wishes.

pli-tv-bi-pm:188.2.eng: If she accepts more than that, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:188.3.pli: Dvattipattapūre paṭiggahetvā tato nīharitvā bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ saṃvibhajitabbaṃ, ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.
pli-tv-bi-pm:188.3.eng: If she accepts two or three bowlfuls, she should take it away and share it with the nuns. This is the proper procedure.

pli-tv-bi-pm:189.0.eng: Confession 120: eating at the wrong time

pli-tv-bi-pm:189.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī vikāle khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:189.1.eng: If a nun eats fresh or cooked food at the wrong time, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:190.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī sannidhikārakaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:190.1.eng: If a nun eats fresh or cooked food that she has stored, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:191.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī adinnaṃ mukhadvāraṃ āhāraṃ āhareyya aññatra udakadantaponā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:191.1.eng: If a nun eats food that has not been given, except for water and tooth cleaners, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:192.0.eng: Confession 123: dismissing a nun during almsround

pli-tv-bi-pm:192.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniṃ, “ehāyye, gāmaṃ vā nigamaṃ vā piṇḍāya pavisissāmā”ti tassā dāpetvā vā adāpetvā vā uyyojeyya, “gacchāyye, na me tayā saddhiṃ kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hoti, ekikāya me kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hotī”ti etadeva paccayaṃ karitvā anaññaṃ, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:192.1.eng: If a nun says to a nun, ‘Come, let’s go to the village or town for alms,’ and then, whether she has had food given to her or not, sends her away, saying, ‘Go away, I’m not comfortable talking or sitting with you, but only if I talk and sit by myself,’ and she does so only for this reason and no other, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:193.0.eng: Confession 124: intruding on a lustful couple

pli-tv-bi-pm:193.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī sabhojane kule anupakhajja nisajjaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:193.1.eng: If a nun sits down intruding on a lustful couple, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:194.0.eng: Confession 125: sitting with a man in a concealed place

pli-tv-bi-pm:194.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī purisena saddhiṃ raho paṭicchanne āsane nisajjaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:194.1.eng: If a nun sits down in private on a concealed seat with a man, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:195.0.eng: Confession 126: sitting alone with a man

pli-tv-bi-pm:195.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā raho nisajjaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:195.1.eng: If a nun sits in private alone with a man, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:195.2.eng: The twelfth subchapter on eating is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:196.0.2.eng: Confession 127: visiting families before a meal

pli-tv-bi-pm:196.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī nimantitā sabhattā samānā santiṃ bhikkhuniṃ anāpucchā purebhattaṃ vā pacchābhattaṃ vā kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjeyya aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:196.1.eng: If a nun who has been invited to a meal visits families beforehand or afterwards without informing an available nun, except on an appropriate occasion, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:196.2.pli: Tatthāyaṃ samayo, cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo, ayaṃ tattha samayo.
pli-tv-bi-pm:196.2.eng: These are the appropriate occasions: it is the robe-giving season; it is a time of making robes.

pli-tv-bi-pm:197.0.eng: Confession 128: accepting an invitation of more than four months

pli-tv-bi-pm:197.1.pli: Agilānāya bhikkhuniyā catumāsappaccayapavāraṇā sāditabbā aññatra punapavāraṇāya, aññatra niccapavāraṇāya. Tato ce uttari sādiyeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:197.1.eng: A nun who is not sick may accept an invitation to ask for requisites for four months. If she accepts one beyond that limit, except if it is a further invitation or a permanent invitation, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:198.0.eng: Confession 129: going to see a mobilized army

pli-tv-bi-pm:198.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī uyyuttaṃ senaṃ dassanāya gaccheyya aññatra tathārūpappaccayā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:198.1.eng: If a nun goes to see an army, except if there is a suitable reason, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:199.0.eng: Confession 130: staying more than three days with an army

pli-tv-bi-pm:199.1.pli: Siyā ca tassā bhikkhuniyā kocideva paccayo senaṃ gamanāya, dirattatirattaṃ tāya bhikkhuniyā senāya vasitabbaṃ. Tato ce uttari vaseyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:199.1.eng: If that nun has a reason for going to the army, she may stay with the army for two or three nights.

pli-tv-bi-pm:200.0.eng: Confession 131: seeing an army in action

pli-tv-bi-pm:200.1.pli: Dirattatirattaṃ ce bhikkhunī senāya vasamānā uyyodhikaṃ vā balaggaṃ vā senābyūhaṃ vā anīkadassanaṃ vā gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:200.1.eng: If a nun who is staying with an army for two or three nights goes to a battle, a troop review, a massing of the army, or a troop inspection, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:201.1.eng: If a nun drinks this or that kind of alcoholic drink, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:202.1.eng: If a nun tickles someone, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:203.1.eng: If a nun plays in water, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:204.1.eng: If a nun is disrespectful, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:205.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniṃ bhiṃsāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:205.1.eng: If a nun scares a nun, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:205.2.eng: The thirteenth subchapter on visiting is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:206.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī agilānā visibbanāpekkhā jotiṃ samādaheyya vā samādahāpeyya vā aññatra tathārūpappaccayā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:206.1.eng: If a nun who is not sick lights a fire to warm herself, or has one lit, except if there is a suitable reason, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:207.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī orenaddhamāsaṃ nahāyeyya aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:207.1.eng: If a nun bathes at intervals of less than a half-month, except on an appropriate occasion, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:207.2.pli: Tatthāyaṃ samayo “diyaḍḍho māso seso gimhāna”nti “vassānassa paṭhamo māso” iccete aḍḍhateyyamāsā uṇhasamayo, pariḷāhasamayo, gilānasamayo, kammasamayo, addhānagamanasamayo, vātavuṭṭhisamayo, ayaṃ tattha samayo.
pli-tv-bi-pm:207.2.eng: These are the appropriate occasions: it is the two-and-a-half-month period of summer and the fever season, comprising the last one-and-a-half months of summer and the first month of the rainy season; she is sick; she is working; she is traveling; there is wind and rain.

pli-tv-bi-pm:208.0.eng: Confession 139: not making stains on a new robe

pli-tv-bi-pm:208.1.pli: Navaṃ pana bhikkhuniyā cīvaralābhāya tiṇṇaṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇānaṃ aññataraṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇaṃ ādātabbaṃ nīlaṃ vā kaddamaṃ vā kāḷasāmaṃ vā. Anādā ce bhikkhunī tiṇṇaṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇānaṃ aññataraṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇaṃ navaṃ cīvaraṃ paribhuñjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:208.1.eng: When a nun gets a new robe, she should apply one of three kinds of stains: blue-green, mud color, or dark brown. If a nun uses a new robe without applying any of the three kinds of stains, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:209.0.eng: Confession 140: using transferred property that is not relinquished

pli-tv-bi-pm:209.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā sikkhamānāya vā sāmaṇerassa vā sāmaṇeriyā vā sāmaṃ cīvaraṃ vikappetvā apaccuddhāraṇaṃ paribhuñjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:209.1.eng: If a nun herself assigns the ownership of a robe to a monk, a nun, a trainee nun, a novice monk, or a novice nun, and she then uses it without the other first relinquishing it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:210.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā nisīdanaṃ vā sūcigharaṃ vā kāyabandhanaṃ vā apanidheyya vā apanidhāpeyya vā antamaso hasāpekkhāpi, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:210.1.eng: If a nun hides a nun’s bowl, robe, sitting mat, needle case, or belt, or she has it hidden, even just for a laugh, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:211.0.eng: Confession 142: intentionally killing a living creature

pli-tv-bi-pm:211.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī sañcicca pāṇaṃ jīvitā voropeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:211.1.eng: If a nun intentionally kills a living being, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:212.0.eng: Confession 143: using water with living creatures

pli-tv-bi-pm:212.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī jānaṃ sappāṇakaṃ udakaṃ paribhuñjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:212.1.eng: If a nun uses water that she knows contains living beings, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:213.0.eng: Confession 144: reopening a settled legal issue

pli-tv-bi-pm:213.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī jānaṃ yathādhammaṃ nihatādhikaraṇaṃ punakammāya ukkoṭeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:213.1.eng: If a nun reopens a legal issue that she knows has been legitimately settled, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:214.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī jānaṃ theyyasatthena saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjeyya antamaso gāmantarampi, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:214.1.eng: If a nun knowingly travels by appointment with a group of thieves, even just to the next inhabited area, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:215.0.eng: Confession 146: not relinquishing a wrong view

pli-tv-bi-pm:215.2.pli: “tathāhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi, yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā, te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:215.2.eng: ‘As I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, the things he calls obstructive are unable to obstruct one who indulges in them,’

pli-tv-bi-pm:215.3.eng: then the nuns should correct her like this:

pli-tv-bi-pm:215.4.pli: “māyye evaṃ avaca, mā bhagavantaṃ abbhācikkhi, na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṃ, na hi bhagavā evaṃ vadeyya,
pli-tv-bi-pm:215.4.eng: ‘No, Venerable, don’t misrepresent the Buddha, for it’s not good to misrepresent the Buddha. The Buddha would never say such a thing.

pli-tv-bi-pm:215.5.pli: anekapariyāyenāyye antarāyikā dhammā antarāyikā vuttā bhagavatā, alañca pana te paṭisevato antarāyāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:215.5.eng: In many discourses the Buddha has declared the obstructive things to be obstructive and how they obstruct one who indulges in them.’

pli-tv-bi-pm:215.6.pli: Evañca sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi vuccamānā tatheva paggaṇheyya, sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsitabbā tassa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bi-pm:215.6.eng: If that nun continues as before, the nuns should press her up to three times to make her stop.

pli-tv-bi-pm:215.7.pli: Yāvatatiyañce samanubhāsiyamānā taṃ paṭinissajjeyya, iccetaṃ kusalaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:215.7.eng: If she then stops, all is well.

pli-tv-bi-pm:215.8.eng: she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:215.9.eng: The fourteenth subchapter on fire is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:216.0.2.eng: Confession 147: living with an ejected nun

pli-tv-bi-pm:216.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī jānaṃ tathāvādiniyā bhikkhuniyā akaṭānudhammāya taṃ diṭṭhiṃ appaṭinissaṭṭhāya saddhiṃ sambhuñjeyya vā, saṃvaseyya vā, saha vā seyyaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:216.1.eng: If a nun lives, does formal meetings, or shares a sleeping place with a nun who she knows is saying such things, who has not made amends according to the rule, and who has not given up that view, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:217.0.eng: Confession 148: supporting a novice nun with a wrong view

pli-tv-bi-pm:217.1.eng: Also if a novice nun says,

pli-tv-bi-pm:217.2.pli: “tathāhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi, yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā, te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:217.2.eng: ‘As I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, the things he calls obstructive are unable to obstruct one who indulges in them,’

pli-tv-bi-pm:217.3.eng: then the nuns should correct her like this:

pli-tv-bi-pm:217.4.pli: “māyye, samaṇuddese evaṃ avaca, mā bhagavantaṃ abbhācikkhi, na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṃ, na hi bhagavā evaṃ vadeyya,
pli-tv-bi-pm:217.4.eng: ‘No, Venerable, don’t misrepresent the Buddha, for it’s not good to misrepresent the Buddha. The Buddha would never say such a thing.

pli-tv-bi-pm:217.5.pli: anekapariyāyenāyye, samaṇuddese antarāyikā dhammā antarāyikā vuttā bhagavatā, alañca pana te paṭisevato antarāyāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:217.5.eng: In many discourses the Buddha has declared the obstructive things to be obstructive and how they obstruct one who indulges in them.’

pli-tv-bi-pm:217.6.pli: Evañca sā samaṇuddesā bhikkhunīhi vuccamānā tatheva paggaṇheyya, sā samaṇuddesā bhikkhunīhi evamassa vacanīyā:
pli-tv-bi-pm:217.6.eng: If that novice nun continues as before, she should be told:

pli-tv-bi-pm:217.7.pli: “ajjatagge te, ayye, samaṇuddese na ceva so bhagavā satthā apadisitabbo,
pli-tv-bi-pm:217.7.eng: ‘From today on you may not refer to the Buddha as your teacher.

pli-tv-bi-pm:217.8.pli: yampi caññā samaṇuddesā labhanti bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ dirattatirattaṃ sahaseyyaṃ, sāpi te natthi,
pli-tv-bi-pm:217.8.eng: And you can no longer share a sleeping place with the nuns for two or three nights, as can other novice nuns.

pli-tv-bi-pm:217.10.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī jānaṃ tathānāsitaṃ samaṇuddesaṃ upalāpeyya vā, upaṭṭhāpeyya vā, sambhuñjeyya vā, saha vā seyyaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:217.10.eng: If a nun supports that novice nun, or she is attended on by her, lives with her, or shares a sleeping place with her, even though she knows that she has been expelled in this way, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:218.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamānā evaṃ vadeyya: “na tāvāhaṃ, ayye, etasmiṃ sikkhāpade sikkhissāmi, yāva na aññaṃ bhikkhuniṃ byattaṃ vinayadharaṃ paripucchāmī”ti, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:218.1.eng: If a nun, when legitimately corrected by the nuns, says, ‘I won’t practice this training rule until I’ve questioned a nun who is an expert on the Monastic Law,’ she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:218.2.pli: Sikkhamānāya, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyā aññātabbaṃ paripucchitabbaṃ paripañhitabbaṃ, ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.
pli-tv-bi-pm:218.2.eng: A nun who is training should understand, should question, should enquire. This is the proper procedure.

pli-tv-bi-pm:219.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī pātimokkhe uddissamāne evaṃ vadeyya: “kiṃ panimehi khuddānukhuddakehi sikkhāpadehi uddiṭṭhehi, yāvadeva kukkuccāya vihesāya vilekhāya saṃvattantī”ti, sikkhāpadavivaṇṇake pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:219.1.eng: When the Monastic Code is being recited, if a nun says, ‘What’s the point of reciting these minor and insignificant training rules, when they just lead to anxiety, oppression, and annoyance?’ then in disparaging the training rules, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:220.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī anvaddhamāsaṃ pātimokkhe uddissamāne evaṃ vadeyya:
pli-tv-bi-pm:220.1.eng: During the half-monthly recitation of the Monastic Code, a nun might say,

pli-tv-bi-pm:220.2.pli: “idāneva kho ahaṃ, ayye, jānāmi ayampi kira dhammo suttāgato suttapariyāpanno anvaddhamāsaṃ uddesaṃ āgacchatī”ti,
pli-tv-bi-pm:220.2.eng: ‘Just now did I find out that this rule too has come down in the Monastic Code, is included in the Monastic Code, and comes up for recitation every half-month.’

pli-tv-bi-pm:220.3.pli: tañce bhikkhuniṃ aññā bhikkhuniyo jāneyyuṃ nisinnapubbaṃ imāya bhikkhuniyā dvattikkhattuṃ pātimokkhe uddissamāne, ko pana vādo bhiyyo, na ca tassā bhikkhuniyā aññāṇakena mutti atthi, yañca tattha āpattiṃ āpannā, tañca yathādhammo kāretabbo, uttari cassā moho āropetabbo:
pli-tv-bi-pm:220.3.eng: If other nuns know that that nun has previously sat through at least two or three recitations of the Monastic Code, then that nun is not let off because of ignorance, and she is to be dealt with according to the rule. Further, she should be charged with deception:

pli-tv-bi-pm:220.4.pli: “tassā te, ayye, alābhā, tassā te dulladdhaṃ, yaṃ tvaṃ pātimokkhe uddissamāne na sādhukaṃ aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi karosī”ti,
pli-tv-bi-pm:220.4.eng: It’s a loss for you that you don’t pay proper attention during the recitation of the Monastic Code.’

pli-tv-bi-pm:220.5.eng: And for the act of deception, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:221.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā kupitā anattamanā pahāraṃ dadeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:221.1.eng: If a nun hits a nun in anger, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:222.0.eng: Confession 153: raising a hand in anger

pli-tv-bi-pm:222.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā kupitā anattamanā talasattikaṃ uggireyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:222.1.eng: If a nun raises a hand in anger against a nun, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:223.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniṃ amūlakena saṅghādisesena anuddhaṃseyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:223.1.eng: If a nun groundlessly charges a nun with an offense entailing suspension, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:224.0.eng: Confession 155: intentionally making a nun anxious

pli-tv-bi-pm:224.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā sañcicca kukkuccaṃ upadaheyya, “itissā muhuttampi aphāsu bhavissatī”ti etadeva paccayaṃ karitvā anaññaṃ, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:224.1.eng: If a nun intentionally makes a nun anxious, thinking, In this way she will be ill at ease at least for a moment,’ and she does so only for this reason and no other, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:225.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhunīnaṃ bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ upassutiṃ tiṭṭheyya, “yaṃ imā bhaṇissanti, taṃ sossāmī”ti etadeva paccayaṃ karitvā anaññaṃ, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:225.1.eng: If a nun eavesdrops on nuns who are arguing and disputing, thinking, ‘I’ll hear what they say,’ and she does so only for this reason and no other, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:225.2.eng: The fifteenth subchapter on one who has been ejected is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:226.0.2.eng: Confession 157: criticizing a legitimate legal procedure

pli-tv-bi-pm:226.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī dhammikānaṃ kammānaṃ chandaṃ datvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṃ āpajjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:226.1.eng: If a nun gives her consent to legitimate legal procedures, and then criticizes them afterwards, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:227.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī saṅghe vinicchayakathāya vattamānāya chandaṃ adatvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkameyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:227.1.eng: When the Sangha is in the middle of a discussion, if a nun gets up from her seat and leaves without first giving her consent, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:228.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī samaggena saṅghena cīvaraṃ datvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṃ āpajjeyya, “yathāsanthutaṃ bhikkhuniyo saṅghikaṃ lābhaṃ pariṇāmentī”ti, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:228.1.eng: If a nun gives out a robe as part of a unanimous Sangha and then criticizes it afterwards, saying, ‘The nuns are diverting the Sangha’s material gains according to friendship,’ she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:229.0.eng: Confession 160: diverting gains intended for the Sangha

pli-tv-bi-pm:229.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī jānaṃ saṅghikaṃ lābhaṃ pariṇataṃ puggalassa pariṇāmeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:229.1.eng: If a nun diverts to an individual material support that she knows was intended for the Sangha, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:230.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī ratanaṃ vā ratanasammataṃ vā aññatra ajjhārāmā vā ajjhāvasathā vā uggaṇheyya vā uggaṇhāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:230.1.eng: If a nun picks up something precious or something regarded as precious, or she has it picked up, except within a monastery or inside a lodging, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:230.2.pli: Ratanaṃ vā pana bhikkhuniyā ratanasammataṃ vā ajjhārāme vā ajjhāvasathe vā uggahetvā vā uggahāpetvā vā nikkhipitabbaṃ, “yassa bhavissati, so harissatī”ti, ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.
pli-tv-bi-pm:230.2.eng: If she picks up something precious or something regarded as precious, or she has it picked up, within a monastery or inside a lodging, she should put it aside with the thought, ‘Whoever owns it will fetch it.’ This is the proper procedure.

pli-tv-bi-pm:231.0.eng: Confession 162: making an improper needle case

pli-tv-bi-pm:231.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī aṭṭhimayaṃ vā dantamayaṃ vā visāṇamayaṃ vā sūcigharaṃ kārāpeyya, bhedanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:231.1.eng: If a nun has a needle case made from bone, ivory, or horn, it is to be destroyed, and she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:232.0.eng: Confession 163: making an inappropriate bed or bench

pli-tv-bi-pm:232.1.pli: Navaṃ pana bhikkhuniyā mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā kārayamānāya aṭṭhaṅgulapādakaṃ kāretabbaṃ sugataṅgulena aññatra heṭṭhimāya aṭaniyā. Taṃ atikkāmentiyā chedanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:232.1.eng: If a nun is having a new bed or bench made, it is to have legs eight standard fingerbreadths long below the lowest frame. If the legs exceed that, they are to be cut down, and she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:233.0.eng: Confession 164: making an upholstered bed or bench

pli-tv-bi-pm:233.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā tūlonaddhaṃ kārāpeyya, uddālanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:233.1.eng: If a nun has a bed or a bench made upholstered with cotton down, it is to be stripped, and she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:234.0.eng: Confession 165: making an oversize itch cloth

pli-tv-bi-pm:234.1.pli: Kaṇḍuppaṭicchādiṃ pana bhikkhuniyā kārayamānāya pamāṇikā kāretabbā, tatridaṃ pamāṇaṃ, dīghaso catasso vidatthiyo sugatavidatthiyā, tiriyaṃ dve vidatthiyo. Taṃ atikkāmentiyā chedanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:234.1.eng: If a nun is having an itch-covering cloth made, it should be made the right size. This is the right size: four standard handspans long and two wide. If it exceeds that, it is to be cut down, and she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:235.0.eng: Confession 166: making an oversize itch robe

pli-tv-bi-pm:235.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī sugatacīvarappamāṇaṃ cīvaraṃ kārāpeyya, atirekaṃ vā, chedanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-pm:235.1.eng: If a nun has a robe made that is the standard robe size or larger, it is to be cut down, and she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-pm:235.2.pli: Tatridaṃ sugatassa sugatacīvarappamāṇaṃ, dīghaso nava vidatthiyo sugatavidatthiyā, tiriyaṃ cha vidatthiyo, idaṃ sugatassa sugatacīvarappamāṇanti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:235.2.eng: This is the standard robe size: nine standard handspans long and six wide.

pli-tv-bi-pm:235.3.eng: The sixteenth subchapter on obstructing a legal procedure is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:236.1.pli: Uddiṭṭhā kho, ayyāyo, chasaṭṭhisatā pācittiyā dhammā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:236.1.eng: Venerables, the hundred and sixty-six rules on confession have been recited.

pli-tv-bi-pm:236.2.eng: In regard to this I ask you, ‘Are you pure in this?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:236.3.eng: A second time I ask, ‘Are you pure in this?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:236.4.eng: A third time I ask, ‘Are you pure in this?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:236.5.eng: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’

pli-tv-bi-pm:236.6.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:237.1.pli: Ime kho panāyyāyo aṭṭha pāṭidesanīyā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:237.1.eng: Venerables, these eight rules on acknowledgment come up for recitation.

pli-tv-bi-pm:238.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī agilānā sappiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya, paṭidesetabbaṃ tāya bhikkhuniyā:
pli-tv-bi-pm:238.1.eng: If a nun who is not sick asks for ghee and then eats it, she must acknowledge it:

pli-tv-bi-pm:238.2.pli: “gārayhaṃ, ayye, dhammaṃ āpajjiṃ asappāyaṃ pāṭidesanīyaṃ, taṃ paṭidesemī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:238.2.eng: ‘I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing that is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.’

pli-tv-bi-pm:239.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī agilānā telaṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya …pe…
pli-tv-bi-pm:239.1.eng: If a nun who is not sick asks for oil and then eats it …

pli-tv-bi-pm:240.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī agilānā madhuṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya …pe…
pli-tv-bi-pm:240.1.eng: If a nun who is not sick asks for honey and then eats it …

pli-tv-bi-pm:241.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī agilānā phāṇitaṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya …pe…
pli-tv-bi-pm:241.1.eng: If a nun who is not sick asks for syrup and then eats it …

pli-tv-bi-pm:242.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī agilānā macchaṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya …pe…
pli-tv-bi-pm:242.1.eng: If a nun who is not sick asks for fish and then eats it …

pli-tv-bi-pm:243.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī agilānā maṃsaṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya …pe…
pli-tv-bi-pm:243.1.eng: If a nun who is not sick asks for meat and then eats it …

pli-tv-bi-pm:244.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī agilānā khīraṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya …pe…
pli-tv-bi-pm:244.1.eng: If a nun who is not sick asks for milk and then eats it …

pli-tv-bi-pm:245.1.pli: Yā pana bhikkhunī agilānā dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya, paṭidesetabbaṃ tāya bhikkhuniyā:
pli-tv-bi-pm:245.1.eng: If a nun who is not sick asks for curd and then eats it, she must acknowledge it:

pli-tv-bi-pm:245.2.pli: “gārayhaṃ, ayye, dhammaṃ āpajjiṃ asappāyaṃ pāṭidesanīyaṃ, taṃ paṭidesemī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:245.2.eng: ‘I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing that is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.’

pli-tv-bi-pm:246.1.pli: Uddiṭṭhā kho, ayyāyo, aṭṭha pāṭidesanīyā dhammā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:246.1.eng: The eight rules on acknowledgment have been recited.

pli-tv-bi-pm:246.2.eng: In regard to this I ask you, ‘Are you pure in this?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:246.3.eng: A second time I ask, ‘Are you pure in this?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:246.4.eng: A third time I ask, ‘Are you pure in this?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:246.5.eng: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’

pli-tv-bi-pm:246.6.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing acknowledgment is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:247.1.pli: Ime kho panāyyāyo, sekhiyā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:247.1.eng: Venerables, these rules to be trained in come up for recitation.

pli-tv-bi-pm:248.0.1.eng: The chapter on evenly all around

pli-tv-bi-pm:248.1.eng: ‘I will wear my sarong evenly all around,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:249.1.eng: ‘I will wear my upper robe evenly all around,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:250.1.eng: ‘I will be well covered while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:251.1.eng: ‘I will be well covered while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:252.1.eng: ‘I will be well restrained while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:253.1.eng: ‘I will be well restrained while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:254.1.eng: ‘I will lower my eyes while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:255.1.eng: ‘I will lower my eyes while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:256.1.pli: Na ukkhittakāya antaraghare gamissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:256.1.eng: ‘I will not lift my robe while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:257.1.pli: Na ukkhittakāya antaraghare nisīdissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:257.1.eng: ‘I will not lift my robe while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:257.2.eng: The first subchapter on evenly all around is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:258.1.pli: Na ujjagghikāya antaraghare gamissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:258.1.eng: ‘I will not laugh loudly while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:259.1.pli: Na ujjagghikāya antaraghare nisīdissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:259.1.eng: ‘I will not laugh loudly while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:260.1.eng: ‘I will not be noisy while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:261.1.eng: ‘I will not be noisy while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:262.1.pli: Na kāyappacālakaṃ antaraghare gamissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:262.1.eng: ‘I will not sway my body while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:263.1.pli: Na kāyappacālakaṃ antaraghare nisīdissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:263.1.eng: ‘I will not sway my body while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:264.1.pli: Na bāhuppacālakaṃ antaraghare gamissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:264.1.eng: ‘I will not swing my arms while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:265.1.pli: Na bāhuppacālakaṃ antaraghare nisīdissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:265.1.eng: ‘I will not swing my arms while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:266.1.pli: Na sīsappacālakaṃ antaraghare gamissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:266.1.eng: ‘I will not sway my head while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:267.1.pli: Na sīsappacālakaṃ antaraghare nisīdissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:267.1.eng: ‘I will not sway my head while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:267.2.eng: The subchapter on laughing loudly is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:268.0.1.eng: The chapter on hands on hips

pli-tv-bi-pm:268.1.pli: Na khambhakatā antaraghare gamissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:268.1.eng: ‘I will not have my hands on my hips while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:269.1.pli: Na khambhakatā antaraghare nisīdissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:269.1.eng: ‘I will not have my hands on my hips while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:270.1.pli: Na oguṇṭhitā antaraghare gamissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:270.1.eng: ‘I will not cover my head while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:271.1.pli: Na oguṇṭhitā antaraghare nisīdissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:271.1.eng: ‘I will not cover my head while sitting in inhabited areas;’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:272.1.pli: Na ukkuṭikāya antaraghare gamissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:272.1.eng: ‘I will not move about while squatting on my heels in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:273.1.pli: Na pallatthikāya antaraghare nisīdissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:273.1.eng: ‘I will not clasp my knees while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:274.1.eng: ‘I will receive almsfood respectfully,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:275.0.eng: Training 28: receiving with attention on the almsbowl

pli-tv-bi-pm:275.1.eng: ‘I will receive almsfood with attention on the almsbowl,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:276.0.eng: Training 29: receiving in the right proportions

pli-tv-bi-pm:276.1.eng: ‘I will receive almsfood with the right proportion of bean curry,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:277.0.eng: Training 30: receiving on an even level

pli-tv-bi-pm:277.1.eng: ‘I will receive an even level of almsfood,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:277.2.eng: The third subchapter on hands on hips is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:278.1.eng: ‘I will eat almsfood respectfully,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:279.0.eng: Training 32: eating with attention on the bowl

pli-tv-bi-pm:279.1.eng: ‘I will eat almsfood with attention on the almsbowl,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:280.1.eng: ‘I will eat almsfood in order,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:281.0.eng: Training 34: eating in the right proportions

pli-tv-bi-pm:281.1.eng: ‘I will eat almsfood with the right proportion of bean curry,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:282.0.eng: Training 35: not masking food into heaps

pli-tv-bi-pm:282.1.pli: Na thūpakato omadditvā piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:282.1.eng: ‘I will not eat almsfood after making a heap,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:283.1.pli: Na sūpaṃ vā byañjanaṃ vā odanena paṭicchādessāmi bhiyyokamyataṃ upādāyāti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:283.1.eng: ‘I will not cover my curries with rice because I want more,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:284.0.eng: Training 37: not requesting rice and bean curry

pli-tv-bi-pm:284.1.pli: Na sūpaṃ vā odanaṃ vā agilānā attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:284.1.eng: ‘When not sick, I will not request bean curry or rice for myself and then eat it,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:285.1.pli: Na ujjhānasaññinī paresaṃ pattaṃ olokessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:285.1.eng: ‘I will not look at another’s almsbowl finding fault,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:286.1.eng: ‘I will not make mouthfuls that are too large,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:287.1.eng: ‘I will make rounded mouthfuls,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:287.2.eng: The fourth subchapter on respectfully is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:288.1.pli: Na anāhaṭe kabaḷe mukhadvāraṃ vivarissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:288.1.eng: ‘I will not open my mouth without bringing a mouthful to it,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:289.1.pli: Na bhuñjamānā sabbahatthaṃ mukhe pakkhipissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:289.1.eng: ‘I will not put my whole hand in my mouth while eating,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:290.0.eng: Training 43: speaking with food in mouth

pli-tv-bi-pm:290.1.pli: Na sakabaḷena mukhena byāharissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:290.1.eng: ‘I will not speak with food in my mouth,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:291.1.eng: ‘I will not eat from a lifted ball of food,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:292.1.eng: ‘I will not eat breaking up mouthfuls,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:293.1.eng: ‘I will not eat stuffing my cheeks,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:294.1.eng: ‘I will not eat shaking my hand,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:295.1.eng: ‘I will not eat scattering rice,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:296.1.eng: ‘I will not eat sticking out my tongue,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:297.1.eng: ‘I will not make a chomping sound while eating,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:297.2.eng: The fifth subchapter on mouthfuls is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:298.1.eng: ‘I will not slurp while eating,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:299.1.eng: ‘I will not lick my hands while eating,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:300.1.eng: ‘I will not lick my almsbowl while eating,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:301.1.eng: ‘I will not lick my lips while eating,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:302.1.pli: Na sāmisena hatthena pānīyathālakaṃ paṭiggahessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:302.1.eng: ‘I will not receive the drinking-water vessel with a hand soiled with food,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:303.1.pli: Na sasitthakaṃ pattadhovanaṃ antaraghare chaḍḍessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:303.1.eng: ‘I will not discard bowl-washing water containing rice in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:304.1.pli: Na chattapāṇissa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:304.1.eng: ‘I will not give a teaching to anyone holding a sunshade who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:305.1.pli: Na daṇḍapāṇissa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:305.1.eng: ‘I will not give a teaching to anyone holding a staff who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:306.1.pli: Na satthapāṇissa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:306.1.eng: ‘I will not give a teaching to anyone holding a knife who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:307.1.pli: Na āvudhapāṇissa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:307.1.eng: ‘I will not give a teaching to anyone holding a weapon who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:307.2.eng: The sixth subchapter on slurping is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:308.1.pli: Na pādukāruḷhassa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:308.1.eng: ‘I will not give a teaching to anyone wearing shoes who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:309.1.pli: Na upāhanāruḷhassa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:309.1.eng: ‘I will not give a teaching to anyone wearing sandals who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:310.1.pli: Na yānagatassa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:310.1.eng: ‘I will not give a teaching to anyone in a vehicle who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:311.1.pli: Na sayanagatassa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:311.1.eng: ‘I will not give a teaching to anyone lying down who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:312.1.pli: Na pallatthikāya nisinnassa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:312.1.eng: ‘I will not give a teaching to anyone who is seated clasping their knees and who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:313.1.pli: Na veṭhitasīsassa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:313.1.eng: ‘I will not give a teaching to anyone with a headdress who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:314.1.pli: Na oguṇṭhitasīsassa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:314.1.eng: ‘I will not give a teaching to anyone with a covered head who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:315.1.pli: Na chamāyaṃ nisīditvā āsane nisinnassa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:315.1.eng: ‘I will not give a teaching while sitting on the ground to anyone sitting on a seat who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:316.1.pli: Na nīce āsane nisīditvā ucce āsane nisinnassa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:316.1.eng: ‘I will not give a teaching while sitting on a low seat to anyone sitting on a high seat who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:317.1.pli: Na ṭhitā nisinnassa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:317.1.eng: ‘I will not give a teaching while standing to anyone sitting who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:318.1.pli: Na pacchato gacchantī purato gacchantassa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:318.1.eng: ‘I will not give a teaching to anyone walking in front of me who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:319.0.eng: Training 72: walking next to the path

pli-tv-bi-pm:319.1.pli: Na uppathena gacchantī pathena gacchantassa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:319.1.eng: ‘I will not give a teaching while walking next to the path to anyone walking on the path who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:320.1.pli: Na ṭhitā agilānā uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā karissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:320.1.eng: ‘When not sick, I will not defecate or urinate while standing,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:321.1.pli: Na harite agilānā uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:321.1.eng: ‘When not sick, I will not defecate, urinate, or spit on cultivated plants,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:322.1.pli: Na udake agilānā uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:322.1.eng: ‘When not sick, I will not defecate, urinate, or spit in water,’ this is how you should train.

pli-tv-bi-pm:322.2.eng: The seventh subchapter on shoes is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:323.1.eng: Venerables, the rules to be trained in have been recited.

pli-tv-bi-pm:323.2.eng: In regard to this I ask you, ‘Are you pure in this?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:323.3.eng: A second time I ask, ‘Are you pure in this?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:323.4.eng: A third time I ask, ‘Are you pure in this?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:323.5.eng: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’

pli-tv-bi-pm:323.6.eng: The chapter on training is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:324.1.pli: Ime kho panāyyāyo, satta adhikaraṇasamathā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:324.1.eng: Venerables, these seven principles for the settling of legal issues come up for recitation.

pli-tv-bi-pm:326.1.eng: Resolution through recollection to be granted.

pli-tv-bi-pm:327.1.eng: Resolution because of past insanity to be granted.

pli-tv-bi-pm:328.1.eng: Acting according to what has been admitted.

pli-tv-bi-pm:331.1.eng: Covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-bi-pm:332.1.pli: Uddiṭṭhā kho ayyāyo satta adhikaraṇasamathā dhammā.
pli-tv-bi-pm:332.1.eng: Venerables, the seven principles for the settling of legal issues have been recited.

pli-tv-bi-pm:332.2.eng: In regard to this I ask you, ‘Are you pure in this?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:332.3.eng: A second time I ask, ‘Are you pure in this?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:332.4.eng: A third time I ask, ‘Are you pure in this?’

pli-tv-bi-pm:332.5.eng: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’

pli-tv-bi-pm:332.6.eng: The seven principles for the settling of legal issues are finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:333.1.eng: Venerables, the introduction has been recited;

pli-tv-bi-pm:333.2.eng: the eight rules on expulsion have been recited;

pli-tv-bi-pm:333.3.eng: the seventeen rules on suspension have been recited;

pli-tv-bi-pm:333.4.eng: the thirty rules on relinquishment and confession have been recited;

pli-tv-bi-pm:333.5.eng: the hundred and sixty-six rules on confession have been recited;

pli-tv-bi-pm:333.6.eng: the eight rules on acknowledgment have been recited;

pli-tv-bi-pm:333.7.eng: the rules on training have been recited;

pli-tv-bi-pm:333.8.eng: the seven principles for the settling of legal issues have been recited.

pli-tv-bi-pm:333.9.pli: Ettakaṃ tassa bhagavato suttāgataṃ suttapariyāpannaṃ anvaddhamāsaṃ uddesaṃ āgacchati.
pli-tv-bi-pm:333.9.eng: This much has come down and is included in the Monastic Code of the Buddha and comes up for recitation every half-month.

pli-tv-bi-pm:333.10.pli: Tattha sabbāheva samaggāhi sammodamānāhi avivadamānāhi sikkhitabbanti.
pli-tv-bi-pm:333.10.eng: In regard to this everyone should train in unity, in concord, without dispute.”

pli-tv-bi-pm:333.11.eng: The fourth recitation, in detail, is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:333.12.eng: The Monastic Code for nuns is finished.

pli-tv-bi-pm:333.13.eng: Homage to the Buddha, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One.
